DRV_ADXL345.description: This component provides the VxBus compliant ADXL345 accelerometer driver. When the probing matches, this driver installs a device on the IO system, with the name of "/accelerometer".

DRV_STORAGE_ATA_HOST.description: Serial ATA controllers includes the following components: DRV_STORAGE_SI31XX , FDT_DRV_STORAGE_FSLSATA, FDT_DRV_STORAGE_FSLAHCI, PCI_DRV_STORAGE_AHCI . The device name may change depending on the port index.

DRV_AM35XX_SPI.description: vxBus Driver for ti am3 SPI bus

DRV_AM38XX_I2C.description: vxBus Driver for ti am3 I2C bus

DRV_AM43XX_SPI.description: vxBus Driver for ti am3 SPI bus

INCLUDE_CHARACTERLCDDRV.description: This component installs the character LCD library. It provides a simply high-level method of reading and writing bytes in absolute character LCD locations through I/O calls.

DRV_INTCTLR_CPM_PIC.description: This component implements the VxBus driver for the CPM PIC interrupt controller. This driver contains support for non-critical and critical interrupts. It provides support for connecting, enabling and disabling interrupt handlers to specific MPIC vectors. Two generic MPIC interrupt handlers are provided, one for non-critical interrupts (vxbMpicIntHandler) and the other one for critical interrupts (vxbMpicCrtIntHandler).

DRV_VXB_EMIF16_NAND.summary: TI EMIF16 NAND Flash controller VxBus Driver
DRV_VXB_EMIF16_NAND.description: TI EMIF16 NAND Flash controller VxBus Driver

INCLUDE_ETSEC_VXB_END.summary: Enhanced TSEC VxBus Enhanced Network Driver
INCLUDE_ETSEC_VXB_END.description: Enhanced TSEC VxBus Enhanced Network Driver

DRV_VXB_FCM.summary: eLBC FCM NAND controller VxBus Driver
DRV_VXB_FCM.description: eLBC FCM NAND controller VxBus Driver

DRV_FDT_ALT5QSPIFLASH.summary: QSPI flash driver for Altera SOC Gen 5
DRV_FDT_ALT5QSPIFLASH.description: QSPI flash driver for Altera SOC Gen 5

DRV_END_FDT_ALT_SOC_GEN5_DWC.summary: Altera SoC Gen 5 DesignWare 3504-0 network driver
DRV_END_FDT_ALT_SOC_GEN5_DWC.description: This component creates an "emac" network interface on a 5th generation Altera ARM SoC using the DesignWare 3504 MAC. It is fully compliant with the IEEE 802.3 10 Mb/s Base-T, 100 Mb/s Base-T, and 1 Gb/s specifications.

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_AM335X.description: This model is the FDT AM335X USB PHY Controller driver

DRV_SIO_FDT_ARM_AMBA_PL011.description: This component provides UART support for ARM AMBA UART compatible devices. This is a generic design of UART used within ARM CPUs, the UART design can share one interrupts for recieving and transmit. Only asynchronous serial operation is supported by the UART which supports 8 bits word lengths with or without parity and with one stop bits.

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_GIC.description: This component includes a driver which supports the ARM Generic Interrupt Controller architecture that is implemented in the ARMv7-A or ARMv7-R processor, which is described in the ARM Generic Interrupt Controller Architecture Specification.

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_GIC_V3.summary: FDT ARM Generic Interrupt Controller Version 3
DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_GIC_V3.description: This component includes a driver which supports the ARM Generic Interrupt Controller Version 3 architecture that is implemented in the ARMv8 processor, which is described in the ARM Generic Interrupt Controller Architecture Specification GIC architecture version 3.0 and version 4.0.

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_GIC_V3_ITS.summary: FDT ARM GIC V3 Interrupt Translation Service (ITS)
DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_GIC_V3_ITS.description: This component includes a driver which supports the ARM GIC V3 Interrupt Translation Service (ITS).

DRV_ARM_GEN_TIMER.description: This component includes a VxBus-compliant timer driver for the ARM generic timer. The number of timers provided by an implementation of the Generic Timer depends on whether the implementation includes the Security Extensions or the Virtualization Extensions.

DRV_TIMER_FDT_ARM_GTC.description: This component includes an implementation for the VxBus-compliant timer driver for the ARM global timer. The ARM global timer is a 64-bit incrementing counter with an auto-incrementing feature. It continues incrementing after sending interrupts. The global timer is accessible to all Cortex-A9 processors in the cluster. Each Cortex-A9 processor has a private 64-bit comparator that is used to assert a private interrupt when the global timer has reached the comparator value.

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_ARM_NVIC.description: This component includes the flattened device tree (FDT) NVIC interrupt controller driver.

DRV_WDT_FDT_ARM_SBSA.description: This component provides the ARM Server Base System Architecture generic watchdog driver support.

INCLUDE_WATCHDOGDRV.description: This component provides the WATCHDOG IOS driver, which attaches a WATCHDOG device to standard I/O streams.

DRV_TIMER_FDT_CORTEXM.description: This component includes the flattened device tree (FDT) Cortex-M system tick timer driver. The system tick timer is defined by the Cortex-M architecture and is intended to provide a system timer clock. It can also be used for a timestamp, but only one sysTick timer is provided and is addressed at 0xE000E0xx. The timer instance can be used in conjunction with other chip specific-timers. If used, it is best suited to the system clock timer.

DRV_END_FDT_FSL_FEC.description: This component creates an "fec" network interface for a Freescale FEC Ethernet controller. The FEC is fully compliant with the IEEE 802.3-2002 double speed 10/100 Mb/s specification.

DRV_TIMER_FDT_FSL_FTM.description: This component provides the Freescale flex timer driver.

DRV_END_FDT_FSL_IMX.summary: Freescale IMX ENET enhanced network driver
DRV_END_FDT_FSL_IMX.description: This component creates an "enet" network interface for the Freescale ENET Ethernet controller found on i.MX embedded processors. The ENET is fully compliant with the IEEE 802.3-2002 triple speed 10/100/1000 Mb/s specification.

DRV_FDT_FSL_IMX_PCIE.description: This component provides PCIe support for Freescale i.MX compatible devices.

DRV_FDT_FSLQSPI.description: This component provides the shared driver for the NXP/Freescale Quad Serial Peripheral Interface (QSPI) controller integrated in various SoCs.

DRV_SRTC_FDT_FSL.description: This component provides the Freescale SRTC VxBus driver.

DRV_FSL_SPI.description: This component imeplements the VxBus driver for the Freescale SPI controller.

DRV_FSL_VYBRID_ADC.description: This component provides the Freescale Vybrid Analog to Digital Converter (ADC) driver. When the probing matches, this driver installs a device on the IO system, with the name of "/adcX", where X is the zero-based unit index of the device.

DRV_RTC_FDT_GOLDFISH.description: This component provides the Google Goldfish RTC VxBus device driver.

DRV_I2C_LCD.description: This component provides the I2C interface to character LCD driver. The driver simply supplies two access routines, one for write character LCD. The upper layer software can make use of the two low level APIs to implement such features.

DRV_GPIO_FDT_KINETIS.description: This component provides the FDT kinetis GPIO driver.

DRV_TIMER_FDT_KINETIS.description: This component provides the Freescale Kinetis timer driver.

INCLUDE_FDT_MICREL_PHY.description: This component implements the VxBus driver for a Micrel PHY device.

DRV_FDT_NXP_FSPI.description: Shared driver for NXP FLEXSPI controller integrated in various SoCs.

DRV_FDT_NXPQSPI.description: Shared driver for NXP QSPI controller integrated in various SoCs.

DRV_DMA_FDT_PL330.description: This component includes the VxBus DMA driver for the PL330 DMA controller. The DMA controller supports 8 channels.

DRV_END_FDT_DWMAC_RZN1.description: This component creates an "dwmac" network interface for the Renesas RZ/N series of 10/100/1000 Ethernet controllers.

DRV_END_FDT_EMSP_RZN1.summary: RZ/N1 Ethernet Mux and Switch Driver
DRV_END_FDT_EMSP_RZN1.description: This component will not create network interface, it is for the Renesas RZ/N1 embedded 5ports switch and Mux module.

DRV_END_FDT_DWMAC_S32G.summary: S32G Synopsys DesignWare Ethernet GMAC Driver
DRV_END_FDT_DWMAC_S32G.description: This component creates a Gigabit Media Access Controller (GMAC) driver for NXP S32G DW Ethernet controllers.

DRV_SENSOR_FDT_LM75.description: This component provides the LM75 sensor driver. When the probing matches, this driver installs a device on the IO system, with the name of "/lm75".

DRV_SENSOR_FDT_MMA8451Q.description: This component provides the MMA8451Q accelerometer driver. When the probing matches, this driver installs a device on the IO system, with the name of "/accelerometer".

DRV_FDT_SP805_WATCHDOG.description: This component provides the ARM SP805 Watchdog driver which attaches the ARM SP805 Watchdog device to Watchdog IOS driver I/O stream.

DRV_TIMER_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DW_TIMER.description: This is the driver for Synopsys DesignWare APB The 32-Bit timers that count down from a programmed value and generate an interrupt when the counter reaches zero.

DRV_DMA_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DW_DMA.description: This component provides DMA support for Synopsys DesignWare DMA compatible devices. The controller's primary purpose                        is to service user-programmed data transfers between two                        end-point devices. This driver supports standard VxBus DMA                      library interfaces.

DRV_END_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DWC.summary: Altera SoC Synopsys DesignWare 3504-0 Network Driver
DRV_END_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DWC.description: This component creates an "emac" network interface on Altera boards using the DesignWare 3504 MAC. It is fully compliant with the IEEE 802.3 10 Mb/s Base-T, 100 Mb/s Base-T, and 1 Gb/s specifications.

DRV_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DW_GPIO.description: This component provides the Synopsys DesignWare GPIO support. It is present on Altera Cyclone V, Arria V and Arria10 processors.

DRV_SYNOPSYS_DW_I2C.description: This component provides support for the DesignWare I2C controller present on Altera Cyclone V and Arria 10 processors. The controller is capable of acting as a master or a slave, and each I2C module instance has one completely independent channel. Only master mode and interrupt mode are supported by this driver.

DRV_FDT_SYNOPSYS_DW_SPI.description: This component provides the driver for Synopsys DesignWare SPI controller.

DRV_FDT_TI_AM572X_PCIE.summary: PCIE support for TI AM572X compatible devices

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_TI_AM572X.description: This model is the FDT TI AM572x USB PHY Controller driver

DRV_PCIE_FDT_TI_AM65X.description: This component provides the TI AM65X PCI Express driver support.

DRV_SERDES_FDT_TI_AM65X.description: This component provides the TI AM65X SerDes PHY driver support.

DRV_USB_PHY_TI_AM65X.description: This component provides the TI AM65X Usb Phy driver support.

DRV_DMA_FDT_TI_K3_RA.description: vxBus Driver for ti K3 platform RINGACC device, provide ringacc public interfaces via VxBus methods.

DRV_DMA_FDT_TI_K3_UDMA.description: vxBus Driver for ti K3 platform UDMA device, provide both memcpy functionality with vxbDmaLib method and public API for slave device transfer.

DRV_INTA_FDT_TI_SCI.description: Use this component to add support for SCI interrupt aggregator of TI SoCs.

DRV_END_TI_NETCP.summary: TI NetCP network driver in switch mode
DRV_END_TI_NETCP.description: Select this component to use the TI NetCP network driver in switch mode.

DRV_END_TI_NETCP_IP.summary: TI NetCP network driver in independent mode
DRV_END_TI_NETCP_IP.description: Select this component to use the TI NetCP network driver in independent port mode.

DRV_FDT_TI_OMAP_MAILBOX.description: This component implements the TI OMAP mailbox driver, providing support for mailbox.

DRV_FDT_TI_REMOTEPROC_K3_R5.description: This component implements the TI Remote Processor K3 R5 driver, providing support for Remote Processor.

DRV_INTR_FDT_TI_SCI.description: Use this component to add support for SCI interrupt router of TI SoCs.

DRV_END_FDT_TI_DA4CPSW.summary: TI Tda4 MCU 2 Port Switch Network Driver
DRV_END_FDT_TI_DA4CPSW.description: TI Tda4 MCU 2 Port Switch Network Driver

DRV_GPIO_FDT_TI_TDA4.description: This component provides the TI TDA4 GPIO driver support.

DRV_FDT_TI_TDA4_PCIE.description: This component provides the PCIe controller for the TI TDA4.

DRV_FDT_TI_TDA4_PCIE_EP.description: This component provides the PCIe EP driver for the TI TDA4.

DRV_FDT_TI_TDA4_PCIE_RC.description: This component provides the PCIe RC driver for the TI TDA4.

DRV_END_FDT_TI_TDA4_VIRT_END.summary: TI TDA4 Main Domain 9 Ports Switch Virtual Network Driver
DRV_END_FDT_TI_TDA4_VIRT_END.description: TI TDA4 Main Domain 9 Ports Switch Virtual Network Driver

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_ALT5.summary: Altera Cyclone V USB PHY Controller driver
INCLUDE_USB_PHY_ALT5.description: Altera Cyclone V USB PHY Controller driver

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_FSL_ONCHIP.summary: FDT Freescale Internal on-chip USB PHY Controller driver
INCLUDE_USB_PHY_FSL_ONCHIP.description: This model is the FDT Freescale on-chip USB PHY Controller driver, which mainly used on fsl_p3041ds,fsl_p5020ds platfroms

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_NXP_IMX8M.summary: NXP i.MX8M USB PHY Controller driver
INCLUDE_USB_PHY_NXP_IMX8M.description: This model is the FDT NXP i.MX8M USB PHY Controller driver

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_RCAR_GEN3.summary: R-Car Gen3 USB PHY Controller driver
INCLUDE_USB_PHY_RCAR_GEN3.description: This model is the R-Car Gen3 USB PHY Controller driver

INCLUDE_USB_PHY_ULPI_VIEWPORT.summary: FDT USB Viewport ULPI PHY Controller driver
INCLUDE_USB_PHY_ULPI_VIEWPORT.description: This model is used as FDT USB ULPI PHY driver to access general ULPI PHYs(such as ISP1504, SMSC3300 and etc) over viewport register.

DRV_END_FDT_XLNX_ZYNQ7K.summary: (Deprecated) Xilinx Zynq-7000 GEM enhanced network driver
DRV_END_FDT_XLNX_ZYNQ7K.description: (Deprecated) Xilinx Zynq-7000 GEM enhanced network driver

DRV_RTC_FDT_ZYNQMP.description: This component provides the Xilinx Zynqmp RTC VxBus device driver.

BRANSON_DRV_END_FDT_TI_PRU_ESC.description: PRU ESC Driver for AM437x Device

INCLUDE_FEI8255X_VXB_END.summary: FEI Intel PRO/100 VxBus enhanced network driver
INCLUDE_FEI8255X_VXB_END.description: This component creates an "fei" network interface for the Intel PRO/100 series of 10/100 Ethernet controllers including the i82557, i82558, i82559, i82550, and i82551.

DRV_FSL_DMA.description: This component provides the driver for the Freescale's DMA engine. It is intended for use by                client drivers performing other high level functions.                This driver provide asynchronous DMA transfer functions. Basic Chaining Mode is                supported in this version, but list descriptor is not supported yet.

DRV_DMA_FDT_FSL_EDMA.description: This component provides DMA support for Freescale eDMA compatible devices. The controller's primary purpose                    is to service user-programmed data transfers between two end-point devices.

DRV_DMA_FDT_FSL_EDMA3.description: This component provides DMA support for Freescale eDMA v3 compatible devices. The controller's primary purpose is to                     service user-programmed data transfers between two                     end-point devices.                     This driver supports standard VxBus DMA library interfaces.

DRV_FSL_ESPI.description: This component provides the driver for the eSPI controller present on many Freescale PPC processors. The controller is capable of acting as a master, and each eSPI module instance usually has four completely independent chipSelect. This driver supports working on interrupt mode, and implements vxbSpiFuncGet method for SPI LIB used, meanwhile, the driver can dynamically switch the SPI mode, frequency and chipSelect according to the device's                requirements.

DRV_FSL_I2C.description: This component implements a driver for the I2C controller presented on many Freescale PPC/ARM processors. The controller is capable of acting as a master or a slave, and each I2C module instance has two completely independent channels. Some Freescale processors may have only one I2C module, while others (such as the P4080/P5020) have two. The ones with two modules will have four completely independent I2C channels. This I2C controller doesn't                support 10 bit addressing, only 7 bit addressing is supported.

DRV_IMX_SDHC_CTRL.summary: FSL IMX SDHC host controller driver
DRV_IMX_SDHC_CTRL.description: FSL IMX SDHC host controller driver

DRV_FSL_MSI.description: This component provides the VxBus Freescale MSI driver.

DRV_FSL_PCI.description: This component provides the VxBus Qoriq PCI controller driver. The driver configures the controllers in root complex (RC) mode. Support is available for both legacy INTx interrupts and MSI interrupts. Support for extended configuration space accesses is also available. Each bridge requires a local access window (LAW) in which to map its outbound data. If using this driver on a processor which also has the QorIQLaw device, and if the QorIQLaw driver is present and registered on vxBus, this driver will automatically use the QorIQLaw driver to allocate and set-up the outbound windows. If the QorIQLaw is unavailable, it is the responsibility of the BSP author to have created corresponding LAW's separately using whatever driver the                particular processor requires. Mappings for prefetchable and non-prefetchable                memio, io16 and io32 regions are all provided.

DRV_VXB_GPMC.summary: GPMC NAND Flash controller VxBus Driver
DRV_VXB_GPMC.description: GPMC NAND Flash controller VxBus Driver

DRV_VXB_GPMI.summary: IMX GPMI NAND controller VxBus Driver
DRV_VXB_GPMI.description: IMX GPMI NAND controller VxBus Driver

DRV_I2C_EEPROM.description: This component provides the VxBus driver for I2C EEPROM. The driver simply supplies two access routines, one for reading EEPROM and the other one for writing EEPROM. The upper layer software can make use of the two low level APIs to implement such features.

DRV_I2C_GPIO_FDT_MAX_731X.description: This component provides the VxBus driver for Maxim I2C GPIO controller MAX731X.

DRV_I2C_PCA954X.description: This component provides the PCA954x I2C mux/switch driver. Supported chips are the octal bidirectional translating multiplexers controlled by the I2C-bus. The SCL/SDA upstream pair fans out to several downstream pairs, or channels. Only one SCx/SDx channel can be selected at a time, determined by the contents of the programmable control register. The device powers up with Channel 0 connected, allowing immediate communication between the master and downstream devices on that channel.

DRV_I2C_PAC193X.description: This component provides the I2C PAC193X vxBus driver. This driver can support Microchip Single/Multi-Channel DC Power/Energy Monitor chips: PAC1931 PAC1932 PAC1933 PAC1934

DRV_I2C_PCFRTC.description: This component provides the PCF8564 I2C RTC vxBus driver. Other I2C real-time clock devices with identical registers such as PCF8563 should also be able to use this driver.

DRV_I2C_RTC.description: This component provides the I2c RTC vxBus driver. This driver can support all Maxim/Dallas I2C RTC device. Other I2C real-time clock devices with identical registers should also be able to use this driver.

DRV_PINMUX_IA.description: Pinmux support for Intel iomux compatible devices

DRV_IA_TPM_INSTANCE_0.description: DRV_IA_TPM driver instance 0 for DRV_IA_TPM device configuration

DRV_MICROCHIP_PCIE.summary: Microchip PCI Express host controller driver
DRV_MICROCHIP_PCIE.description: Microchip PCI Express host controller driver support

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_MPIC.description: This component provides the VxBus driver for MPIC interrupt controller. This driver contains support for non-critical and critical interrupts. It provides support for connecting, enabling and disabling interrupt handlers to specific MPIC vectors. Two generic MPIC interrupt handlers are provided, one for non-critical interrupts (vxbMpicIntHandler) and the other one for critical interrupts (vxbMpicCrtIntHandler).

DRV_NEXUS_GENERIC.description: This component provides the default root nexus support driver. It may be overridden by a platform-specific or BSP-specific driver if desired.

DRV_VXB_NORFLASH_CMDSET_AMD.summary: AMD/Spansion Nor Flash command set library
DRV_VXB_NORFLASH_CMDSET_AMD.description: AMD/Spansion Nor Flash command set library

DRV_VXB_NORFLASH_CMDSET_ITL.summary: Intel Nor Flash command set library
DRV_VXB_NORFLASH_CMDSET_ITL.description: Intel Nor Flash command set library

DRV_PCI_ECAM.description: This component provides PCIe support for ECAM functionality.

DRV_INTCTLR_FDT_NXP_IRQSTEER.description: This component provides the VxBus driver for Interrupt Request Steering module. The irqstr module redirects/steers the incoming interrupts to output interrupts of a selected/designated channel as specified by a set of configuration registers.

DRV_TIMER_OPENPIC.description: This component provides the VxBus driver for the openPic timer. A driver-specific data structure (struct openPicTimerInstance) is allocated for each timer instance and a pointer to it is stored in 'pInst->pDrvCtrl' during openPicTimerInstInit(). openPicTimerInstance contains an array of (struct openPicTimerData), one for each timer in the instance.

DRV_PCI_BRIDGE_GENERIC.description: This component provides the generic VxBus PCI bridge driver.

DRV_PCI_VGA_STUB.description: This component provides the VxBus PCI VGA stub driver.

DRV_RCAR_H3_MMC.summary: R-Car H3 MMC host controller driver
DRV_RCAR_H3_MMC.description: R-Car H3 MMC host controller driver

INCLUDE_RTL8169_VXB_END.description: This component creates an "rtg" network interface for the RealTek 'C+' family of PCI 10/100 and 10/100/1000 Ethernet controllers.

DRV_STORAGE_SI31XX.description: Supports 3124 and 3132 Silicon Image Serial ATA controllers

DRV_PDMA_FDT_SIFIVE.description: This component provides the driver for the SiFive PDMA engine. It is intended for use by client drivers performing other high level functions. This driver provides asynchronous DMA transfer functions.

DRV_QSPI_FDT_SIFIVE.description: This enables access to SiFive QSPI controller which supports 1, 2 or 4 bus width transmission.

DRV_SPIFLASH_SP25.summary: Spansion S25XX serials SPI Flash vxBus Driver
DRV_SPIFLASH_SP25.description: This enables access to most modern SPI flash chips, series supported include Atmel AT25, Spansion S25, ST M25P, EN25 and Winbond W25X. Other chips are supported as well. See the driver source for the current list. Note that the Atmel AT45 series, need an entirely different driver (DRV_SPIFLASH_AT45).

DRV_SPI_FLASH.description: This enables access to most modern SPI flash chips, series supported include Atmel AT25, Spansion S25, ST M25P, EN25 and Winbond W25X. Other chips are supported as well. See the driver source for the current list. This driver is a replace for DRV_SPIFLASH_SP25, so it cannot be used together with DRV_SPIFLASH_SP25.

DRV_CLK_FDT_TI_AM5.summary: Clock management support for TI AM5 clock compatible devices

DRV_VXBEND_TEI82598.summary: Intel PRO/10GbE VxBus enhanced network driver
DRV_VXBEND_TEI82598.description: This component creates a "tei" network interface for the following Intel devices: 82598, 82599, x540, and x550EM PCI Express controller chips.

DRV_VXBEND_TEI82598VF.summary: Intel PRO/10GbE VF VxBus enhanced network driver
DRV_VXBEND_TEI82598VF.description: This component creates a "teivf" network interface for the following Intel devices: x540 and x550 PCI Express controller chips virtual function.

DRV_SIO_TI_AM3.summary: UART support for Ti Am33xx devices
DRV_SIO_TI_AM3.description: UART support for Ti Am33xx devices

DRV_AM572x_QSPI.description: Branson vxBus Driver for AM572x QSPI Controller

DRV_AM654X_MCSPI.description: vxBus Driver for ti am654x SPI bus

DRV_TI_AM_QSPI.summary: QSPI support for Ti Amxx devices
DRV_TI_AM_QSPI.description: QSPI support for Ti Amxx devices

DRV_TI_EDMA3.description: This component implements a driver for TI EDMA3 (Enhanced DMA version 3) controller. The controller's primary purpose is to service user-programmed                data transfers between two end-point devices.                                The TI EMDA3 controller uses PARAM set for DMA transfer. A PARAM set                is a set of parameters that define how the transfer should be handled,                eg. source address, destination address, interrupt mode, etc. Before                 actually triggering the DMA engine, one or more PARAM set(s) must be                 set correctly.                                The TI EDMA3 controller has an internal buffer RAM, before triggering                any DMA transfer, PARAM set must be copied to the corresponding                 internal buffer RAM.

DRV_CLOCK_FDT_TI_SCI.description: Use this component to add support for SCI clock of TI SoCs.

DRV_POWERDOMAIN_FDT_TI_SCI.description: Use this component to add support for SCI Power domain of TI SoCs.

DRV_TI_TDA4X_OSPI.summary: OSPI support for Ti Tda4x devices
DRV_TI_TDA4X_OSPI.description: OSPI support for Ti Ada4x devices

INCLUDE_USB_TCPC_INTERFACE.description: This model is the USB TCPC interface driver

INCLUDE_USB_TCPC_MANAGER.description: This model is the USB TCPC manager driver

DRV_NXP_CBT104GP.summary: CBT104GP driver used by USB TCPC manager
DRV_NXP_CBT104GP.description: This model is the CBT104GP driver used by USB TCPC manager

DRV_BUS_VIRT.description: This component provides the VxBus virtual bus controller driver. The virtual bus allows a user to add user-defined VxBus nodes to the tree on the fly at runtime. This is useful for implementing virtual devices which aren't necessarily tied to real hardware, or for simple experimentation                with VxBus and driver design. Normally a device can not be added to the                tree except by a parent node that is already part of it, since vxbDevAdd()                requires a parent node handle. With the virtual bus driver, the root nexus                creates a virtual bus node which is the parent of all virtual devices, and                an API is provided for adding new children to this node.

DRV_VIRTUAL_TIMER_WATCHDOG.description: This component provides the Virtual Timer Watchdog driver, which attaches a Virtual Timer Watchdog device to Watchdog IOS driver I/O stream

DRV_WATCHDOG_IOCTL_SC.description: This component provides VxBus Watchdog IOCTL command validation for RTP.

DRV_XSPI_FLASH.description: This enables access to most modern XSPI flash chips which maybe can support single, dual, quad, octal transfer mode.

BRANSON_INCLUDE_PRUDRV.description: Attach the LED device to standard I/O

BRANSON_INCLUDE_LEDDRV.description: Attach the LED device to standard I/O

BRANSON_DRV_I2C_PLL_CLK_SYNTH.description: vxBus Driver for I2c clk synthesizer

BRANSON_DRV_AM437x_QSPI.description: vxBus Driver for AM437x QSPI Controller

BRANSON_DRV_I2C_TPS62362_VOLTAGE_REGULAT.description: vxBus Driver for I2c voltage regulator

BRANSON_INCLUDE_QSPI.description: Attach the QSPI device to standard I/O

INCLUDE_SYNOPSYSHCI_INIT.description: Initializes Synopsys USB HOST Controller Driver

DRV_USB_DWC3_TI.description: DesignWare USB3 DRD controller Driver for TI OMAP5 and similar Platforms

INCLUDE_USB_DWC3_HCD.description: DesignWare USB3 DRD controller host driver

DRV_USB_DWC3_XLNX_VERSAL.summary: DWC3 USB driver for Xilinx Versal
DRV_USB_DWC3_XLNX_VERSAL.description: DesignWare USB3 DRD controller Driver for Xilinx Versal

INCLUDE_USB_DWC3_TCD.description: DesignWare USB3 DRD controller device driver

INCLUDE_USB_FSL_TCD_INIT.description: Initializes the FSL USB Target Controller Driver

INCLUDE_USB_FSL_SHOW.summary: Freescale Dual-Role USB Controller Information Show
INCLUDE_USB_FSL_SHOW.description: Shows Freescale Dual-Role USB Controller hardware or software information

INCLUDE_USB_TRACK_FSLDR.description: Enable the USB FSLDR Controller Debugging Tracking

INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC.description: Mentor Graphics USB Module Driver. Only Centaurus platform is supported by default.

INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC_OCD_HCD_INIT.summary: USB MHDRC OTG OCD and HCD Init
INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC_OCD_HCD_INIT.description: USB MHDRC OTG OCD and HCD Initialization

INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC_OCD_TCD_INIT.summary: USB MHDRC OTG OCD and TCD Init
INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC_OCD_TCD_INIT.description: USB MHDRC OTG OCD and TCD Initialization

INCLUDE_USB_MHDRC_TCD_INIT.description: Initialize Mentor Graphics USB Target Controller Driver

INCLUDE_USB_PCHUDC_TCD_INIT.description: Initializes the PCHUDC USB Target Controller Driver

INCLUDE_USB_PCHUDC_SHOW.description: Shows Intel USB Controller hardware or software information

INCLUDE_USB_TRACK_PCHUDC.description: Enable the USB PCHUDC Controller Debugging Tracking

INCLUDE_USB_XHCI_HCD.description: USB 3.0 xHCI HCD for eXtensible Host Controller Interface

INCLUDE_RZN1_PCI_USBH.description: VxBus PCI driver for RZN1 USB host

INCLUDE_RZN1_USB_TCD_INIT.description: Initializes the RZN1 USB Target Controller Driver

INCLUDE_RZN1_USB_TCD_INIT_SHELL_EDIT.summary: RZN1 USB TCD Variables Init Edit Command

INCLUDE_RZN1_USB_RNDIS_INIT.description: Initializes RNDIS over the RZN1 USB TCD Driver

INCLUDE_SCEP.description: Obtains certificates for a client by identity from a SCEP server.

IPCOM_ENABLE_USER_SHELL.description: Use this Boolean parameter to enable the IPCOM user shell. It is set to false by default.

IPCOM_START_SHELL.description: Specifies the IPCOM user start shell function.

IPCOM_SHELL_PROMPT.description: The prompt displayed by the shell when it is waiting for commands. Supported special characters are: "\p" - shell process name "\P" - shell process ID "\i" - the IP address of the target "\w" - the current working directory "\W" - the basename of the current working directory "\V" - ipcom_getenv("VR")

IPCOM_TELNET_PORT.description: Specifies the telnet server port in the host endian.

IPCOM_TELNET_MAX_CLIENTS.summary: Maximum number of simultaneous telnet clients
IPCOM_TELNET_MAX_CLIENTS.description: IPCOM_TELNET_MAX_CLIENTS controls the maximum number of simultaneous telnet clients. If set to 0, the number is unlimited.

IPCOM_TELNET_CFGFILE.description: The full pathname to a file containing telnet configuration parameters to be processed during system boot, or an empty string, which disables this capability.

IPCOM_TELNET_DELAYEDSTART.description: Normally, the telnet server starts when the operating system boots. Setting this value to TRUE delays starting the telnet server until an "ipd" command is issued.

IPCOM_TELNET_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the telnet network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

IPCOM_TELNET_IDLE_TIMEOUT.description: Specifies the idle timeout, in minutes, for a telnet client. A telnet client is automatically logged out if no input is detected for the specified amount of time. Specifying a timeout value of 0 dictates that the telnet client never times out due to inactivity.

IFCONFIG_1.description: Specifies the interface parameters to be configured when the stack is initialized, as a list of attribute-value strings, for example: "ifname eth0","devname fei0", "gateway driver", "inet 10.1.2.100/24","inet6 3ffe:1:2:3::4/64". The following keywords are recognized. (1) "ifname" - specifies the name of the ethernet interface, e.g. "ifname eth0". If the interface name is missing after "ifname", then the END device name will be used. (2) "devname" - specifies which driver this interface should attach itself, "fei0". The default is set to "driver" so that device name is retrieved from device boot parameters. (3) "inet" - specifies the interface IPv4 address and subnet, e.g. "inet 10.1.2.100/24". Instead of IPv4 address, there also exists a few special syntaxes: "inet driver" means address and mask should be read from the BSP. "inet dhcp" means address and mask should be received from a DHCP server. The gateway might also be received from that server (depends on the DHCP server configuration). "inet rarp" means address and mask should be received from a RARP server. The default is set to "driver" so that device name is retrieved from device boot parameters. (4) "gateway" - specifies the default gateway used for IPv4, e.g. "gateway 10.1.2.1". Only ONE default gateway can be specified. "gateway driver" may be used to take the gateway from the boot parameters. (5) "inet6" - specifies the interface IPv6 address and subnet, e.g. "inet6 3ffe:1:2:3::4/64". The 'tentative' keyword can be inserted before the address if the stack should do duplicate address detection on the address before assigning it to the interface, e.g. "tentative 3ffe:1:2:3::4/64". (6) "gateway6" - specifies the default gateway used for IPv6. Only ONE default gateway can be specified.

The following keywords are recognized. (1) "ifname" - specifies the name of the ethernet interface, e.g. "ifname eth0".
