To configure the cache at run time, call the function usrNfs2CacheInit( ): usrNfs2CacheInit (UINT32 numLines, UINT32 lineSize, UINT32 options); Changing the size of the cache does not affect any existing cache. It only impacts future caches.

NFS2_CLIENT_CACHE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS.description: This parameter configures the default options for the NFS v2 client cache. If it is set to 0, the default value, the cache collects the written data and only sends it to the server when the cache line is full, or it needs to be flushed (no options). If set to 1, the cache is write-through. You can modify the cache options, either at build time or at run time. To configure the cache at run time, call the function usrNfs2CacheInit( ): usrNfs2CacheInit (UINT32 numLines, UINT32 lineSize, UINT32 options);

NFS3_CLIENT_CACHE_DEFAULT_NUM_LINES.description: The NFS client implementation uses a persistent cache, which is structured as a multi-line buffer cache. This parameter configures the default number of lines in the NFS v3 client cache. The default value is 16. The value can be decreased to as low as 1, or increased. You can modify the number of cache lines, either at build time or at run time. To configure the cache at run time, call the function usrNfs3CacheInit( ): usrNfs3CacheInit (UINT32 numLines, UINT32 lineSize, UINT32 options);

NFS3_CLIENT_CACHE_DEFAULT_LINE_SIZE.summary: Default number of bytes in the cache line
NFS3_CLIENT_CACHE_DEFAULT_LINE_SIZE.description: The NFS client implementation uses a persistent cache, which is structured as a multi-line buffer cache. The cache line size must be a power of two. This parameter configures the default size of the NFS v3 client cache line. The default value for this is 16384 (16 KB). When combined with the default number of cache lines, this yields a default cache size of 256 KB. You can modify the cache line size, either at build time or at run time. To configure the cache at run time, call the function usrNfs3CacheInit( ): usrNfs3CacheInit (UINT32 numLines, UINT32 lineSize, UINT32 options); Changing the size of the cache does not affect any existing cache. It only impacts future caches.

NFS3_CLIENT_CACHE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS.description: This parameter configures the default options for the NFS v3 client cache. If it is set to 0, the default value, the cache collects the written data and only sends it to the server when the cache line is full, or it needs to be flushed (no options). If set to 1, the cache is write-through. You can modify the cache options, either at build time or at run time. To configure the cache at run time, call the function usrNfs3CacheInit( ): usrNfs3CacheInit (UINT32 numLines, UINT32 lineSize, UINT32 options);

NFS_USER_ID.description: This parameter sets the user identifier for NFS access. By default, it is set to 2001.

NFS_GROUP_ID.description: This parameter sets the group identifier for NFS access. By default, it is set to 100.

NFS_MAXPATH.description: Indicates maximum length of a file path excluding the file name. By default, it is set to 255. The maximum value of this parameter is 1024.

NFS_CLIENT_AUTO_CLOSE.summary: Auto close client after file close
NFS_CLIENT_AUTO_CLOSE.description: Auto close client after file close. NFS client will not close if set this parameter to FALSE, this could improve NFS performance by saving time for re-setup client.

GROUP_EXPORTS.summary: Remove check for GroupName during MountAll
GROUP_EXPORTS.description: An NFS server can specify that an exported file system is intended for a particular group of clients. Before mounting an exported file system, a client typically checks that it is a group member. If the client is not a group member, it does not mount the file system. To configure the client to skip this check, set this parameter to TRUE. The default value (FALSE) ensures that the check occurs.

NFS_MAXFILENAME.description: Indicates the maximum length of a file name. If a file name is longer than this value then it is truncated before it is returned to the client. This parameter must be set carefully because it affects the amount of memory allocated by the server. Valid values range from 1 to 99.

NFS_DEBUG_LEVEL.description: This parameter sets the Network File System (NFS) debug level. When this value greater than the corresponding ERROR or NORMAL information level, debug information can be output. NFS_NONE_DEBUG 0, NFS_ERROR_DEBUG 1, NFS_WARNING_DEBUG 2, NFS_NORMAL_DEBUG 3, NFS_VERBOSE_DEBUG 4.

NFS_CLIENT_TCP_PORT_RANGE.summary: NFS Client TCP Port Range Array
NFS_CLIENT_TCP_PORT_RANGE.description: TCP port range for NFS client to connect with server. This parameter indicates the lower-bound and upper-bound.

XBD_BLK_DEV_DIRECT_BIO_HANDLING.description: If the value is set to TRUE, then the tXbdService task will not be created. The data will be read or written with direct BIO mode by user task.

XBD_BLK_CACHE_DEF_NODE_COUNT.summary: Default XBD block cache node count
XBD_BLK_CACHE_DEF_NODE_COUNT.description: This parameter specifies the default XBD cache node count.

XBD_BLK_CACHE_DEF_NODE_SIZE.summary: Default XBD block cache node size

XBD_PARTITION_CREATION_ALIGNMENT.description: This parameter specifies partition sector aligment of partition creation tools (including: xbdCreatePartition, xbdCreatePartitionSz, etc)

MAX_LIO_CALLS.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of lio calls. By default, it is set to zero.

MAX_AIO_SYS_TASKS.summary: Number of tasks spawned to support AIO
MAX_AIO_SYS_TASKS.description: Sets the number of tasks spawned during the initialization of the AIO system driver. The default is zero.

AIO_TASK_PRIORITY.description: Sets the priority level of the tasks spawned during the initialization of the AIO system driver. The default is zero.

AIO_TASK_STACK_SIZE.description: Sets the initial stack size. The default is zero.

NUM_DRIVERS.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of drivers. By default, it is set to 20.

NUM_FILES.summary: maximum number of open files in the kernel
NUM_FILES.description: Limit to FD_SETSIZE (2048) when using selectLib

MAX_FD_TABLE_SIZE.summary: Upper bound size of a growable file descriptor table for the kernel or RTP. Note that when select() support is included and SELECT_FDSET_OVERSIZE_ALLOW is not enabled, this value is ignored and FD_SETSIZE is used instead.
MAX_FD_TABLE_SIZE.description: Maximum number of open file descriptors per RTP

DEV_NAME_POLICY.summary: IO system device name policy flags
DEV_NAME_POLICY.description: A combination of the bit flags IOS_DEVNAMEPOL_NO_BACKSLASHES, IOS_DEVNAMEPOL_STARTS_WITH_SEP, IOS_DEVNAMEPOL_NO_TRAILING_SEP, IOS_DEVNAMEPOL_NO_MULTICOMP and IOS_DEVNAMEPOL_GENERIC. Restricts device names when using INCLUDE_PATHNAME_RESOLUTION_LEGACY. The value 0 means 'anything goes'.

PIPE_MAX_OPEN_FDS.summary: maximum open fds for each pipe device
PIPE_MAX_OPEN_FDS.description: maximum open fds for each pipe device

FIFOS_DEV_NAME.summary: POSIX pipes and FIFOs device name
FIFOS_DEV_NAME.description: Name of POSIX pipes and FIFOs object device

PX_PIPE_BUFFER_SIZE.summary: buffer size used by POSIX pipe
PX_PIPE_BUFFER_SIZE.description: buffer size used by POSIX pipe

TYLIB_XOFF_PCNT.description: Send XOFF when rcv buff exceeds this level (%).

TYLIB_XON_PCNT.description: Send XON when rcv buff drops below this level (%).

TYLIB_WRT_THRESHLD.description: Wakeup tty writer tasks when tx buffer has this much available space (chars).

SELECT_FDSET_OVERSIZE_ALLOW.summary: Allow FD tables larger than FD_SETSIZE
SELECT_FDSET_OVERSIZE_ALLOW.description: Normally, the kernel and RTP file descriptor tables should be no larger than FD_SETSIZE when select() support is included. When this parameter is TRUE, RTP file descriptor tables are allowed to be larger than FD_SETSIZE descriptors. Some applications using select() may not expect this, and any that do will need to manually allocate and initialize extra-large fd_set structures.

FILESYSTEM_SYMLINK_CONFIG_STR.description: Filesystem symbolic link config string. Format "[<def>=default target root path];                                    [LINK_NAME=TARGET_PATH or LINK_NAME=<def>/PATH];                             [LINK_NAME=TARGET_PATH or LINK_NAME=<def>/PATH];                             ...." 1. If the DEFAULT_TARGET_ROOT_PATH "[<def>=                                     DEFAULT_TARGET_ROOT_PATH]" is specified, it must be the first entry. 2. Target path must be specified for every symbolic link entry, it could be full path, e.g. [/bin=/romfs/bin], also could use default root path, e.g. "[/bin=<def>/bin]". 3. Skip the entry when default target root path is not specified and target path refer to the default target root path. 4. Each of LINK_NAME and TARGET_PATH should be less than PATH_MAX in length. 5. Do not put any space char in config string. e.g. "<def>=/romfs;/bin=<def>/bin;/lib=<def>/lib;/usr=<def>/usr;/etc=<def>/etc;/boot=<def>/boot": /bin -> /romfs/bin /lib -> /romfs/lib /usr -> /romfs/usr /etc -> /romfs/etc /boot -> /romfs/boot "<def>=/romfs;/bin=/romfs/bin;/lib=<def>/lib": /bin -> /romfs/bin /lib -> /romfs/lib "/bin=/romfs/bin;/lib=<def>/lib": /bin -> /romfs/bin

STORE_ABS_SYMBOLS.description: This parameter indicates whether or not to store absolute symbols in the system symbol table.

WV_RBUFF_MGR_PRIORITY.description: Initial priority of rBuff manager task for System Viewer

RTP_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.summary: Number of entries in the RTP create/delete hook table
RTP_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.description: The value of this configuration parameter specifies the number of entries in the RTP hook table.

SYSCALL_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.summary: Number of entries in the system call hook tables
SYSCALL_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.description: This parameter sets the number of entries in the system call hook tables. If system call hook functions are not required or used in a deployed system, set this parameter's value to zero (doing so also disables the syscallMonitor() facility).

RTP_SIGNAL_QUEUE_SIZE.description: This parameter defines the maximum number of queued signals allowed in a process. The default value, 32, is set in accordance with the POSIX 1003.1 standard (_POSIX_SIGQUEUE_MAX). Changing the value to a lower number can cause problems for applications relying on POSIX guidelines. For POSIX, this value must be at least 32.

RTP_HEAP_INIT_SIZE.description: This parameter sets the initial size in bytes for the heap for each RTP created; the HEAP_INITIAL_SIZE environment variable can override this parameter.

RTP_HEAP_DEFAULT_OPTIONS.summary: Memory partition options for the RTP heap
RTP_HEAP_DEFAULT_OPTIONS.description: This parameter defines the default memory partition for an RTP heap.

RTP_FD_NUM_MAX.summary: Number of entries in an RTP fd table
RTP_FD_NUM_MAX.description: For any given RTP, the maximum number of file descriptors (fd) for all I/O devices cannot exceed the value of this parameter.

RTP_MEM_FILL.description: When set to TRUE, this parameter fills the RTP stack with 0xee, and all other RTP memory allocations with 0. This parameter overrides VX_NO_STACK_FILL for the RTP execution stack. VX_GLOBAL_NO_STACK_FILL overrides this component (RTP_MEM_FILL) for the RTP task execution stack. A TRUE value implies memory allocated to private mapping is initialized to 0. This improves security but decreases performance. Set to FALSE to improve performance.

SD_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.summary: Number of entries in the SD hook tables
SD_HOOK_TBL_SIZE.description: This parameter defines the number of entries in the shared data (SD) hook tables.

RTP_APPL_INIT_STRING.description: This parameter hosts a string-encoded list of RTPs that will be launched after bootup. For more information, see the "VxWorks Programmer's Guide: Automatic Execution of RTP Applications."

RTP_CPU_USAGE_WINDOW_SIZE.summary: Window size in tick to measure the CPU usage time and compute the average
RTP_CPU_USAGE_WINDOW_SIZE.description: The number of ticks to use as a window to compute the average of the CPU usage rate. Must be greater than zero.

RTP_SYSTEM_RESOURCE_GROUP_MAX_CPU_USAGE_.summary: Maximum rate of CPU usage by System Resource Group
RTP_SYSTEM_RESOURCE_GROUP_MAX_CPU_USAGE_.description: Maximum CPU utilization for the System resource group, which includes the kernel. The value is a percentage; 100 or more implies no CPU usage limit for the System resource group. 0 will result a failure initializing INCLUDE_RTP_RESOURCE_GROUP and INCLUDE_RTP_CPU_USAGE_CTRL components.

SHELL_TASK_NAME_BASE.description: This parameter provides the default basename for the kernel shell tasks.

SHELL_TASK_OPTIONS.description: This parameter provides the default spawning options for the kernel shell tasks.

SHELL_STACK_SIZE.description: This parameter defines the shell stack size in bytes.

SHELL_START_AT_BOOT.summary: Kernel shell launched at boot time
SHELL_START_AT_BOOT.description: This parameter is used to automatically launch the kernel shell on the console at boot time. You cannot disable shell startup at boot time in compatible mode (SHELL_COMPATIBLE parameter).

SHELL_COMPATIBLE.summary: Compatible behavior of the kernel shell
SHELL_COMPATIBLE.description: This parameter sets the kernel shell compatibility mode. The kernel shell is configured to be compatible with the VxWorks 5.5 shell: one shell session, global I/O redirected, shell task options without the Vx_PRIVATE_ENV bit. You cannot use shell compatibility mode with a secure shell or when shell startup is disabled at boot time (INCLUDE_SHELL_SECURITY component and/or SHELL_START_AT_BOOT parameter).

SHELL_DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: This parameter sets the default configuration variables of the kernel shell as a string.

SHELL_FIRST_CONFIG.description: This parameter sets the specific configuration variables of the initial kernel shell session as a string.

SHELL_REMOTE_CONFIG.description: This parameter sets the specific configuration variables of the kernel shell sessions started for a remote connection as a string.

SHELL_MAX_SESSIONS.summary: Maximum number of simultaneous shell sessions
SHELL_MAX_SESSIONS.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of simultaneous shell sessions allowed at a time. When the session limit is reached, further connections are rejected with a message to the user. Setting the value to -1 disables the session limit system. This feature is not available in compatible mode (SHELL_COMPATIBLE parameter).

SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_STACK_SIZE.summary: Stack size of tasks spawned by the shell
SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_STACK_SIZE.description: This parameter defines, in bytes, the stack size of the tasks spawned by the sp( ), period( ), and repeat( ) shell functions.

SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_PRIORITY.summary: Priority of tasks spawned by the shell
SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter defines the priority of the tasks spawned by the sp( ), period( ), and repeat( ) shell functions.

SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_OPTIONS.summary: Options of tasks spawned by the shell
SHELL_SPAWNED_TASK_OPTIONS.description: This parameter defines the options of the tasks spawned by the sp( ), period( ), and repeat( ) shell functions.

DEBUG_STACK_TRACE_BUF_SIZE.summary: Initial size of buffer used to collect task stack trace output
DEBUG_STACK_TRACE_BUF_SIZE.description: This parameter controls the size of the buffer initially allocated to collect stack trace output for a task. The buffer can usually be grown if necessary while collecting the output; but if the stack trace code detects that the (stopped) task being traced holds the system heap mutex, it will not attempt to grow the output buffer (in order to avoid deadlock); and stack trace output may be truncated in this case. One can avoid this by setting this parameter sufficiently large that the buffer need never be grown while collecting the stack trace output.

SHELL_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter provides the default priority for the kernel shell tasks.

SPY_TASKS_MAX.description: Maximun number of taks that can be spied

STOP_MODE_AGENT_STACK_SIZE.summary: Stack size of the Stop Mode Agent
STOP_MODE_AGENT_STACK_SIZE.description: The stack size of the context executing the Stop Mode Agent

STOP_MODE_AGENT_TTY_CHANNEL.summary: Serial channel for Stop Mode Agent connection
STOP_MODE_AGENT_TTY_CHANNEL.description: Defines the serial channel number to use for Stop Mode Agent connection

STOP_MODE_AGENT_TTY_BAUD_RATE.summary: Baud rate for Stop Mode Agent serial channel
STOP_MODE_AGENT_TTY_BAUD_RATE.description: Defines Stop Mode Agent serial baud rate

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_NAME.summary: Device to use for Stop Mode Agent connection
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_NAME.description: Alternative device to use for Stop Mode Agent connection. If none specified, use boot device.

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_UNIT.summary: Device unit number for Stop Mode Agent connection
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_UNIT.description: Device unit number to use for Stop Mode Agent connection. This is used only if a Stop Mode Agent END device name is specified.

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_ADDRESS.summary: IP address to use for Stop Mode Agent connection
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_DEVICE_ADDRESS.description: Alternative IP address to use for Stop Mode Agent connection. If none specified, use boot address.

STOP_MODE_AGENT_MTU.summary: MTU for Stop Mode Agent communication channel
STOP_MODE_AGENT_MTU.description: Defines Stop Mode Agent communication MTU

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_NUM_MBUFS.summary: Stop Mode Agent number of network buffers
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_NUM_MBUFS.description: Used to initialize Stop Mode Agent buffer pool

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_NUM_CL_BLKS.summary: Stop Mode Agent number of network buffer clusters
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_NUM_CL_BLKS.description: Used to initialize Stop Mode Agent buffer pool

STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_PORT.summary: Default Stop Mode Agent communication port
STOP_MODE_AGENT_END_PORT.description: Defines Stop Mode Agent communication port number

STAT_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2.summary: error status table hash size (as a power of 2)
STAT_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2.description: The size of the error status hash table is specified as a power of two. For example, if STAT_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2 is 6, a 64-entry hash table is created.

SYM_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2.summary: symbol table hash size (as a power of 2)
SYM_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2.description: The size of the symbol hash table is specified as a power of two. For example, if SYM_TBL_HASH_SIZE_LOG2 is 8, a 256-entry hash table is created.

USER_TIMESTAMPLOCK.description: Same as Timestamp but with interrupts locked

USER_TIMECONNECT.description: Connect a user routine to a timestamp timer interrupt

USER_TIMEPERIOD.description: Get the period of a timestamp timer

USER_TIMEFREQ.description: Get a timestamp timer clock frequency

WV_DEFAULT_BUF_MIN.description: Sets the minimum number of buffers in the system viewer.

WV_DEFAULT_BUF_MAX.description: Sets the maximum number of buffers in the system viewer.

WV_DEFAULT_BUF_SIZE.description: Sets the default size of each buffer.

WV_MAX_LOGS.summary: Maximum number of Wind View logs
WV_MAX_LOGS.description: Maximum number of Wind View logs on target at any time.

WV_UPLOAD_STACK_SIZE.summary: Stack allocated to System Viewer upload task
WV_UPLOAD_STACK_SIZE.description: Stack allocated to System Viewer upload task

WV_UPLOAD_PRIORITY.description: Initial priority of System viewer upload task

USER_WV_BUFF_INIT.description: Sets the routine to initialize user-defined buffer manager.

TIP_CONFIG_STRING.description: Used to define connection lines attributes

VXDBG_EVT_TASK_STACK_SIZE.description: Defines stack size of VxDBG task (bytes)

APPL_LOG_FD_CFG.description: Default application logging file descriptor for non-kernel facilities.

APPL_LOG_LEVEL_CFG.summary: Default application logging mask and flags
APPL_LOG_LEVEL_CFG.description: Default application logging mask and flags for non-kernel facilities.

APPL_KERN_LOG_FD_CFG.description: Default logging file descriptor for KERN_LOG facility.

APPL_KERN_LOG_LEVEL_CFG.summary: Default kernel logging mask and flags
APPL_KERN_LOG_LEVEL_CFG.description: Default logging mask and flags for KERN_LOG facility.

DNSC_SERVER_PORT.description: Specifies the port used by IPDNSC for DNS queries, e.g. "53"

DNSC_TIMEOUT.summary: Timeout in seconds when waiting for responses to DNS queries
DNSC_TIMEOUT.description: Defines the number of seconds before a retry if the DNS server fails to answer, e.g. "10"

DNSC_RETRIES.summary: Number of retries for DNS queries
DNSC_RETRIES.description: Defines the number of retries on each name server, e.g. "2"

DNSC_DOMAIN_NAME.description: Defines the domain where the local host is located. If this system variable is not defined, no local domain is used and the user must provide fully qualified domain names in address lookups for hosts in the same domain as the local host.

DNSC_PRIMARY_NAME_SERVER.description: Defines the address to the primary name server. If this system variable is not defined no primary name server is used.

DNSC_SECONDARY_NAME_SERVER.description: Defines the address to the secondary name server. If this system variable is not defined no secondary name server is used.

DNSC_TERTIARY_NAME_SERVER.description: Defines the address to the tertiary name server. If this system variable is not defined no tertiary name server is used.

DNSC_QUATERNARY_NAME_SERVER.description: Defines the address to the quaternary name server. If this system variable is not defined no quaternary name server is used.

DNSC_IP4_ZONE.summary: Zone for IPv4 address to name lookups
DNSC_IP4_ZONE.description: Defines the zone to use for address to name lookups of IPv4 addresses.

DNSC_IP6_ZONE.summary: Zone for IPv6 address to name lookups
DNSC_IP6_ZONE.description: Defines the zone to use for address to name lookups of IPv6 addresses. Set to "ip6.int" to support RFC1886 or to "ip6.arpa" to support RC3152.

DNSC_CFGFILE.description: The full pathname to a target resident file containing DNS Client configuration parameters to be processed during system boot or an empty string to disable this capability.

FTPC_BIND_ADDRESS.description: This parameter specifies the bind address for the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) client.

FTPS_CFGFILE.description: This parameter specifies the full pathname to a target file containing the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server configuration parameters to be processed during system boot, or an empty string to disable this capability.

FTPS_DELAYEDSTART.description: Normally, the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server starts when the operating system boots. Setting this parameter to TRUE delays starting the FTP server until a "ipd" command is issued.

FTPS_AUTH_ATTEMPTS.description: This parameter specifies the number of authentication attempts that are allowed before the server disconnects.

FTPS_SLEEP_TIME.summary: Time to sleep after authentication fail
FTPS_SLEEP_TIME.description: This parameter defines how many seconds the server sleeps for before replying to an unsuccessful authentication.

FTPS_LOCAL_PORT_BASE.description: This parameter specifies the local port base which defines the port range the server uses for the data connection. A value of 0 instructs the server to use port 20.

FTPS_PEER_PORT_BASE.description: This parameter specifies the peer port base which defines the port range that the client is allowed to use when setting up the data connection.

FTPS_ENABLE_PROXY.description: This parameter specifies whether or not to enable proxy File Transfer Protocol (FTP) support.

FTPS_MODE.description: Read-only mode disables write access to the file system, which means that only read commands are accepted. The default value is 0, which allows read/write access.

FTPS_ROOT_DIR.description: This parameter defines the top-most directory that the client can see.

FTPS_INITIAL_DIR.description: This parameter defines the initial directory for a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) session.

FTPS_MAX_SESSIONS.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of simultaneous File Transfer Protocol (FTP) sessions.

FTPS_PORT_NUM.description: This parameter specifies the server port number.

FTPS_RECV_TIMEOUT.description: This parameter specifies the timeout in seconds when receiving data from the client.

FTPS_SEND_TIMEOUT.description: This parameter specifies the timeout in seconds when sending data to the client.

FTPS_INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT.description: This parameter specifies the timeout in seconds when waiting for a command from the client.

FTPS_SOCKET_BACKLOG.description: This parameter determines the backlog queue length of the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server control socket. The default value is 0.

FTPS_SYS_TYPE.description: This parameter specifies the operating system name.

FTPS_AUTH_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: This parameter specifies a user-defined authentication callback routine to be used by the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server. If not specified, the internal authentication callback routine, ipftps_authenticate_default_callback, is used.

FTPS_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

FTPS_SESSION_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the priority of the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) session task. Changing this value can have risks.

FTPS_DATABUF_SIZE.description: Data transfer buffer size used in each FTP session

TFTPS_DIRS.description: Specifies the working directory for the TFTP server.

TFTPS_RETRANSMIT_TIMEOUT.description: Specifies the time until the first retry is sent (in seconds). Further retries use an exponential back-off algorithm.

TFTPS_RETRIES.description: Specifies the number of times a TFTP message is retried if an acknowledgment is not received from the peer.

TFTP_CFGFILE.description: The full path to a target file containing the TFTP configuration parameters to be processed during system boot or an empty string, which disables this capability.

TFTPS_DELAYEDSTART.description: Normally, the TFTP server starts when the operating system boots. Setting this parameter to TRUE delays the start of the TFTP server until an "ipd" command is issued.

TFTPS_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the Trivial File Transport Protocol (TFTP) server network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

DHCPC6_DUID_TYPE.description: DHCP6 Client DUID Type. Possible values are "ll","llt", or "en".

DHCPC6_DUID_EN_NUM.description: DHCP6 Client DUID EN Number. Must be specified for EN.

DHCPC6_DUID_EN_VAL.description: DHCP6 Client DUID EN Value. Must be specified for EN.

DHCPC6_IF_ENUM_LIST.description: Specifies the dhcp6 Client operation mode on a given interface. The input is specified as a list of interface/Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_RAPID_COMMIT_LIST.description: Specifies whether rapid commit is enabled on a given interface. The input is specified as a list of interface/Rapid Commit Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_INFORMATION_ONLY_LIST.description: A list of interface/Information Only Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_DNS_LIST.description: A list of interface/DNS Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_SNTP_LIST.description: A list of interface/SNTP Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=enable"

DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_LIST.description: A list of interface/Information Refresh Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=enable"

DHCPC6_IF_SIP_LIST.description: A list of interface/SIP Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=enable"

DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_MIN_LIST.summary: Interface Information Refresh Min Status List
DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_MIN_LIST.description: A list of interface/Information Refresh Minimum Value pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=600;vlan21=600"

DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_DEFAULT_LIST.summary: Interface Information Refresh Default Status List
DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_DEFAULT_LIST.description: A list of interface/Information Refresh Default Value pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=86400;vlan21=86400"

DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_MAX_LIST.summary: Interface Information Refresh Max Status List
DHCPC6_IF_INFO_REFRESH_MAX_LIST.description: A list of interface/Information Refresh Maximum Value pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=0;vlan21=0"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_NA_DEFAULT_LIST.description: A list of interface/IA_NA Default Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_NA_DEFAULT_IAID_LIST.description: A list of interface/IA_NA Default IAID pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=1;vlan21=2"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_ENUM_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Hints Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_PREFIX_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Prefix Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=3FFE:01;vlan21=3FFE:02"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_VALID_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Valid Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=7000"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_PREFERRED_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Preferred Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=7000"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_RENEW_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Renew Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=4000"

DHCPC6_IF_HINTS_DEFAULT_REBIND_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default Rebind Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=4000"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_DEFAULT_LIST.description: A list of interface/IA_PD Default Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_DEFAULT_IAID_LIST.description: A list of interface/IA_PD Default IAID pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=1;vlan21=2"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_ENUM_LIST.summary: Interface IA_PD Default Hints Status List
DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_ENUM_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Hints Status pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=enable;vlan21=automatic"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_PREFIX_LIS.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Prefix Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=3FFE:01;vlan21=3FFE:02"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_VALID_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Valid Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=7000"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_PREFERRED_.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Preferred Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=7000"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_RENEW_LIST.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Renew Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=4000"

DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_REBIND_LIS.summary: DHCP Client IA_PD Interface Rebind List
DHCPC6_IF_IA_PD_HINTS_DEFAULT_REBIND_LIS.description: A list of interface/Default IA_PD Rebind Hints pairs, each separated from the other by a semi-colon as follows: "eth0=8000;vlan21=4000"

DHCPC6_HMAC_MD5_SECRET.description: Specifies the key used by the client to authenticate DHCPV6 messages.

DHCPC6_AUTHENTICATION_REALM.description: Specifies the DHCPV6 authentication realm used by the client

DHCPC6_INSTALL_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK.summary: Install DHCP6 Client Reply Callback Routine
DHCPC6_INSTALL_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: Determine if the user-defined DHCP6 client callback routine as specified by the macro DHCPC6_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK should be installed. If FALSE, the DHCPC6_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK configuration is not applicable.

DHCPC6_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: This callback can be just used to do things related to user,If not specified, the internal reply callback routine will be used. The DHCPC6_INSTALL_REPLY_CALLBACK_HOOK must also be set to TRUE in order to install this callback routine.

DHCPC6_TASK_PRIORITY.description: Set the priority of the task,change the value may have risk

DHCPC6_CFGFILE.description: The full pathname to a target file containing DHCP6 Client configuration parameters to be processed during system boot or an empty string to disable this capability.

DHCPR_SERVER_PORT.summary: UDP port used by the DHCP server
DHCPR_SERVER_PORT.description: This parameter defines the UDP port used for reception by the DHCP/BOOTP servers that are handled by the DHCP relay agent.

DHCPR_CLIENT_PORT.summary: UDP port used by the DHCP/BOOTP clients
DHCPR_CLIENT_PORT.description: This parameter defines the UDP port used for reception by the DHCP/BOOTP clients that are handled by the DHCP relay agent.

DHCPR_MAX_PKT_SIZE.description: This parameter defines the packet size used by the DHCP relay agent for sending and receiving. The size cannot be less than 576 bytes, which is the standard DHCP packet size.

DHCPR_HOPS_THRESHOLD.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of relay agents allowed between a client and a server. Packets with a hops count greater than this threshold value are silently dropped.

DHCPR_NETCONF_SYSVAR.description: The DHCP relay network pre-configuration array is used to statically configure the DHCP relay with a pre-configured setup of networks and hosts when initiated. Each system variable in this array must be named according to the syntax "ipdhcpr.netconf.<index>", where "<index>" is a unique line indicator. The value of each system variable must consist of a IPDHCPR shell command (without the preceding dhcpr that is used only when executing from a shell). The commands are executed in the order they are defined. For an example usage, see ipdhcpr_netconf_sysvar Ipcom_sysvar array in the ipdhcpr_config.c configlette.

DHCPR_INSTALL_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: This parameter is used to determine if the user-defined DHCP relay callback routines, as specified by the DHCPR_START_CALLBACK_HOOK macro, are installed. If FALSE, the DHCPR_START_CALLBACK_HOOK configuration is not applicable.

DHCPR_START_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: If provided, the DHCP relay startup callback routine is called by DHCP relay at startup. This routine is intended to be used for a user-supplied startup configuration of the DHCP relay. To install this callback hook, DHCPR_INSTALL_CALLBACK_HOOK must be set to TRUE.

DHCPR_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the DHCP relay agent network service task. Changing this value can have risks.

DHCPS6_MODE.description: The mode the DHCPv6 daemon is running in, can be "server" or "relay". Default is "server".

DHCPS6_DUID_IFNAME.description: The interface the server uses to generate the server ID.

DHCPS6_ALLOW_RAPID_COMMIT.description: Specifies if the server allows rapid commit or not. Valid values are "yes" or "no".

DHCPS6_MAXHOP_COUNT.description: Specifies the maximum hop count in a relay-forward message.

DHCPS6_IF_RELAY_MAP_LIST.description: Specifies the interface to receive the DHCPv6 server or relay agent messages that are received on the given interface. Leave the address field empty to use the all-dhcp-servers (ff05::1:3) multicast address. The input is specified as a list of source interface/destination interface pairs, each separated from the other with a semicolon as follows: "eth0=eth1;vlan21=eth2"

DHCPS6_HMAC_MD5_SECRET.description: Specifies the key used by the server to authenticate DHCPv6 messages.

DHCPS6_AUTHENTICATION_REALM.description: Specifies the DHCPv6 authentication realm used by the server.

DHCPS6_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the DHCPv6 server network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

MCP_UPSTREAM_IFNAME.description: The interface where all multicast packets arrive at. The proxy is acting as a multicast host on this interface, e.g "eth0".

MCP_DOWNSTREAM_IFNAMES.description: Collection of interface to which multicast packets arriving to the upstream inteface will be forwarded to if that multicast group has at least one listener, e.g. "eth1,eth2"

MCP_ROBUSTNESS_VAR.description: Multicast router robustness variable. This variable allows tuning for the expected packet loss on a link.

MCP_QUERY_INTERVAL.description: The interval between MLD general queries sent by multicast proxy in querier.

MCP_QUERY_RESP_INTERVAL.description: The maximum response delay allowed for a multicast client to answer on a general MLD query.

MCP_LAST_LISTERNER_QUERY_INTERVAL.description: The maximum response delay allowed for a multicast client to answer on a group specific MLD query.

MCP_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the MCP network service task. Changing the value may have risks.

NTP_INIT_PARAM.description: This parameter specifies the Network Time Protocol (NTP) startup parameters. For example, "-c /ram/ntp.conf -g -A".

NTP_CONFIG_PARAM.description: This parameter specifies the Network Time Protocol (NTP) configuration parameters typically specified in the configuration file (for example, /ram0/ntp.conf). This macro is not used if the configuration file is defined with the "-c" parameter in NTP_INIT_PARAM, or NTP_CONFIG_FILENAME is defined. Each parameter must be separated by a semicolon. For example: "driftfile /ram/ntp.drift; server 1.debian.pool.ntp.org iburst;                     server 2.debian.pool.ntp.org iburst; disable auth"

NTP_CONFIG_FILENAME.description: This parameter specifies the Network Time Protocol (NTP) configuration file name. This macro is not used if the configuration file is defined with the "-c" parameter in NTP_INIT_PARAM. Otherwise, if NTP_CONFIG_FILENAME is defined, the NTP server reads configuration parameters from this file. If it is NULL, the NTP server uses NTP_CONFIG_PARAM to boot up.

NTP_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the Network Time Protocol (NTP) network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

PPP_DEFAULT_BAUDRATE.description: THis sets the initial baud rate for the PPP RS232 serial driver.

PPP_RUNMODE.description: Specifies one or more runmode options on an interface. The possible runmode options are "start", "passive" , "exit" "wincompat".

PPP_FLAGS.description: Sets behaviors and options on an interface. The parameter value is an ASCII string with one or more flag options. There are two flag options defined: defaultroute This adds a default route to the system routing tables using the peer as the gateway, when the IPCP/IPV6CP negotiation is successfully completed. proxyarp This adds a proxy ARP route flag ( RTF_PROTO2) to the peer host route when IPCP negotiation is successfully completed. When this is set, the target will act as proxy for the host. One or more additional interfaces on the target must have proxy ARP enabled. ARP requests for the host address that come in on these interfaces will be processed by the target. See the Wind River Network Stack for VxWorks Programmer's  Guide for information about enabling proxy ARP.

PPP_AUTH_MODES.description: Sets the authentication requirements on a PPP interface. The parameter value is an ASCII string with one or more authentication options. There are six options defined. auth This requires the peer to authenticate itself before allowing sending or receiving of IPCP or IPV6CP. noauth This does not require the peer to authenticate itself (that is, do not ask for authentication.) pap The peer must authenticate using the PAP protocol. refuse-pap Do not agree to authenticate using PAP. chap The peer must authenticate using the CHAP protocol. refuse-chap Do not agree to authenticate using CHAP.

PPP_LCP_ECHO_REQ_INTERVAL.description: LCP EchoReq output interval in seconds. 0 to disable.

PPP_LCP_ECHO_REQ_FAILURE.description: Max echo request failures before link termination.

PPP_IPCP_IPV4_ADDRESS.description: Specifies the desired local IPv4 address. Setting local IPv4 address to 0.0.0.0 means asking the peer to suggest our IPv4 address.

PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS.description: Set a suggested peer IPv4 address. Note that the peer IPv4 address will only get suggested to the peer if it asks for it by requesting IP address 0.0.0.0.

PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_POOL_NAME.description: Defines the name of the address pool used to supply peers with IPv4 addresses when running as a PPP or PPPoE server. The configuration consists of two steps. First a pool must be defined with a name with PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_POOL_NAME. The start and end IPv4 addresses pool are then defined with PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_POOL. E.g. "default".

PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_POOL.description: Configures a IPv4 address pool associated with the pool name defined by PPP_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_POOL_NAME. This address pool is used to supply peers with IPv4 addresses when running as a PPP or PPPoE server. E.g., "10.1.3.1-10.1.3.255".

PPP_IPCP_PRIMARY_DNS_ADDRESS.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 primary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (i.e. the client) if the peer requests a primary DNS address. E.g. "10.1.2.3".

PPP_IPCP_SECONDARY_DNS_ADDRESS.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 secondary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a secondary DNS address. E.g. "195.42.198.5".

PPP_IPCP_PRIMARY_NBNS_ADDRESS.description: Configures PPP client IPv4 primary NBNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (i.e. the client) if the peer requests a primary NBNS (WINS) address. E.g., "10.1.2.2".

PPP_IPCP_SECONDARY_NBNS_ADDRESS.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 secondary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a secondary DNS address. E.g. "195.42.198.4".

PPP_L2TP_LNS_ADDRESS_DEFAULT.summary: Default Address for L2TP Network Server
PPP_L2TP_LNS_ADDRESS_DEFAULT.description: Configures a default address for PPP over L2TPv2 for a Network Server. This address will be used by PPP when establishing a PPP over L2TPv2 connection, when no another address has been assigned. E.g. "195.42.198.4".

PPP_INSTALL_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: Determines if the user-defined PPP action callback routine as specified by the macro PPP_ACTION_CALLBACK_HOOK should be installed. If FALSE, the PP_ACTION_CALLBACK_HOOK configuration is not applicable.

PPP_ACTION_CALLBACK_HOOK.description: User-defined PPP action callback routine. In order for PPP to function, this callback function used by PPP must be implemented to handle various PPP actions like initialization, startup, peer IPv4 address requests, Peer authentication login etc. If not specified, the internal PPP action callback routine will be used. The PPP_INSTALL_CALLBACK_HOOK must also be set to TRUE in order to install this callback hook.

PPP_LCP_CLOSE_IF_NO_NCP_OPENED.summary: Close LCP link if no ncp is opened
PPP_LCP_CLOSE_IF_NO_NCP_OPENED.description: Close LCP link if there is no more ncp is in opened state.

PPP_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the priority of the task. Changing its value may have risks.

PPP_IF_DEFAULT_BAUDRATE_LIST.description: PPP RS232 serial driver baudrate. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=38400;ppp1=38400".

PPP_IF_RUNMODE_LIST.description: Specifies one or more runmode options on an interface. Possible runmode options are "start", "passive" and "exit". This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=start,passive".

PPP_IF_FLAGS_LIST.description: Specifies one or more flag behavioural options on an interface. Possible flags options are "defaultroute" and "proxyarp". This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=proxyarp;ppp1=proxyarp".

PPP_IF_AUTH_MODES_LIST.description: Configures the required authentication modes. There are six authentication modes - "auth", "noauth", "pap", "refuse-pap", "chap", and "refuse-chap". This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "ppp0=chap;ppp1=pap".

PPP_IF_USERNAME.description: Configures the username for this interface. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "ppp0=PPP1;ppp1=PPP2".

PPP_IF_PASSWD.description: Configures the password for this interface. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "ppp0=PAS1;ppp1=PAS2".

PPP_IF_LCP_MRU_LIST.description: Specifies interface LCP maximum receive unit. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=1500;ppp1=1500".

PPP_IF_LCP_MTU_LIST.description: Specifies interface LCP maximum transmit unit. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon.. E.g, "ppp0=1500;ppp1=1500".

PPP_IF_LCP_ECHO_REQ_INTERVAL_LIST.description: LCP echo request output interval in seconds. 0 to disable. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon.. E.g, "ppp0=60;ppp1=60".

PPP_IF_LCP_ECHO_REQ_FAILURE_LIST.description: Max echo request failures before link termination. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=5;ppp1=5".

PPP_IF_IPCP_IPV4_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Specifies the desired local IPv4 address. Setting local IPv4 address to 0 means asking the peer to suggest our IPv4 address. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=12.0.0.100;ppp1=12.1.0.100".

PPP_IF_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Suggest peer IPv4 address if asked for. Note that the peer IPv4 address will only get suggested to the peer if it ask for it by requesting IP address 0. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "ppp0=10.1.4.1;ppp1=10.2.4.1".

PPP_IF_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_POOL_LIST.description: Configure a IPv4 address pool used for the interface to supply peers with IPv4 addresses when running as a PPP or PPPoE server. This parameter is configurable on a per- interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>". Each pair of "<ifparam>=<value>" is semicolon separated. E.g., "ppp0=10.1.3.1-10.1.3.255".

PPP_IF_IPCP_PRIMARY_DNS_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 primary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a primary DNS address. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "ppp0=10.1.2.3;ppp1=10.2.2.3".

PPP_IF_IPCP_SECONDARY_DNS_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 secondary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a secondary DNS address. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "ppp0=195.42.198.5;ppp1=195.43.198.5".

PPP_USERS_LCP_ECHO_REQ_INTERVAL_LIST.description: LCP echo request output interval in seconds. 0 to disable. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "user1=60;user2=60".

PPP_USERS_IPCP_IPV4_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Specifies the desired local IPv4 address. Setting local IPv4 address to 0.0.0.0 means asking the peer to suggest our IPv4 address. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "user1=12.0.0.100;user2=12.1.0.100".

PPP_USERS_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Suggest peer IPv4 address if asked for. Note that the peer IPv4 address will only get suggested to the peer if it ask for it by requesting IP address 0.0.0.0. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>" each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g, "user1=10.1.4.1;user2=10.2.4.1".

PPP_USERS_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_POOL_LI.summary: Users IPv4 peer address pool list
PPP_USERS_IPCP_PEER_IPV4_ADDRESS_POOL_LI.description: Configure a IPv4 address pool used for a user to supply peers with IPv4 addresses when running as a PPP or PPPoE server. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g., "user1=10.1.3.1-10.1.3.255;user2=10.2.3.1-10.2.3.255"

PPP_USERS_IPCP_PRIMARY_DNS_ADDRESS_LIST.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 primary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a primary DNS address. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "user1=10.1.2.3;user2=10.2.2.3".

PPP_USERS_IPCP_SECONDARY_DNS_ADDRESS_LIS.description: Configures the PPP client IPv4 secondary DNS address. The configured IPv4 address will be given to the peer (the client) if the peer requests a secondary DNS address. This parameter is configurable on a per-user basis in the form of "<username>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "user1=195.42.198.5;user2=195.43.198.5".

PPPOE_SERVER.description: Enable(1) /disable(0) PPPoE server. If the option is set to "1", PPPoE server is enabled, a value of "0" disabled it for the whole device or for a specific interface.

PPPOE_SECRET_NAME.description: Sets the secret name for the PPPoE cookie. It is used in a MD5 checksum calculation to thwart DOS (denial-of-service) attacks. The definition of the string need not match any remote configuration! The value should be changed from its factory default.

PPPOE_MAX_SESSIONS.description: Maximum total number of PPPoE sessions allowed before incoming PPPoE PADI packets are ignored, i.e. the PPPoE server will not accept any additional connections.

PPPOE_MAX_ETH_SESSIONS.description: Maximum number of PPPoE sessions per Ethernet interface. Note that the interface name used is the Ethernet interface name and not the pppoe interface name.

PPPOE_AC_NAME.description: This sets the PPPoE access concentrator name (AC-Name).

PPPOE_SERVICE_NAME.description: This parameter specifies the service name to accept. Do not set it to accept "any" service name.

PPPOE_IF_MAX_ETH_SESSIONS_LIST.description: Maximum number of PPPoE sessions per Ethernet interface. Note that the interface name used is the Ethernet interface name and not the PPPoE interface name. This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", each separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "eth0=8;eth1=8".

PPPOE_IF_SERVICE_NAME_LIST.description: This parameter sets the list of service names to accept. Do not set to "any". This parameter is configurable on a per-interface basis in the form of "<ifparam>=<value>", where each are separated from the other by a semicolon. E.g. "eth0=myservicename1;eth1=myservicename2".

PPPMP_ENABLE.description: If the option is set to "1", the PPP multilink protocol(MP) is enabled. A value of "0" disables it for the whole device or for a specific interface.

PPPMP_MRRU.description: Maximum size for packets received using the multilink protocol after being reconstructed, if necessary, from fragments received over multiple links.

PPPMP_SSN.summary: PPP MP Short Sequence Number header Enable(1) / Disable(0)
PPPMP_SSN.description: Controls Short Sequence numbers. In PPP multilink, packets are transferred as multilink fragments, each one having a sequence number to aid in reconstruction. By default sequence numbers are 24 bits, but 16-bits can be negotiated to save packet overhead. The PPPMP_SSN parameter enables this negotiation, which is described in RFC 1990.

PPPMP_FRAG_DISABLE.summary: PPP MP PDU Fragmentation Disable (1) or Enable (0)
PPPMP_FRAG_DISABLE.description: If this option is set to "1", the PPP MP stack will try to prevent protocol data unit (PDU) fragmentation. If the PDU is smaller then the link's maximum transmission unit (MTU),                 it will be sent unfragmented.                 If the PDU is bigger then the link's MTU, it will be fragmented. Note, that default value is 0 - it means that all MTUs will be fragmented.

PPPMP_PPPOE_LINKS.description: Number of links which will be started for multilink use when a PPPoE interface is started.

PPPVJC_ENABLE.description: Controls if VJC negotiation is initiated on each new connection. The default is 0 (disabled). Set to 1 to enable.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_DOMAIN.description: RADIUS server domain for IPCOM authentication, IP_AF_INET=2 or IP_AF_INET6=24.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_IPV4_ADDRESS.description: RADIUS server IPv4 address for IPCOM authentication.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_IPV6_ADDRESS.description: RADIUS server IPv6 address for IPCOM authentication.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_PORT.description: RADIUS server port in host endian for IPCOM authentication.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_SHARE_SECRET.description: RADIUS server shared secret for IPCOM authentication.

IPCOM_AUTH_RADIUS_SERVER_PASSWD_TYPE.description: RADIUS server password type (PAP=1, CHAP=2) for IPCOM authentication.

SNTP_LISTENING_PORT.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) listening port.

SNTP_BIND_IPV6_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) IPv6 source address.

SNTP_BIND_IPV4_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) IPv4 source address.

SNTP_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the task priority of the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) network service task. Changing the value can have risks.

SNTPS_STRATUM.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server stratum.

SNTPS_PRECISION.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server precision. Precision, in seconds, is 2 ^ SNTPS_PRECISION.

SNTPS_MULTICAST_INTERVAL.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast mode send interval in seconds. For unicast mode only, set this value to zero.

SNTPS_MULTICAST_TTL.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast mode time-to-live (TTL).

SNTPS_IPV4_MULTICAST_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server multicast mode IPv4 destination address.

SNTPS_IPV6_MULTICAST_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server multicast mode IPv6 destination address.

SNTPS_LEAP_SECOND_FILENAME.description: This parameter specifies the name of leap second file to be read by the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server every day. The file contains the leap second to be adjusted in NTP timestamp format. For example, "3644697600    36    # 1 Jul 2015". If there is a leap second adjustment, the SNTP server sets the LI flag automatically in that day. Contents of this file can be derived from leap-second bulletins posted by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS).

SNTPC_POLL_INTERVAL.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) client unicast mode poll interval. For multicast mode only, set this value to zero.

SNTPC_POLL_COUNT.description: This parameter specifies the number of re-transmissions the client attempts on each Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server.

SNTPC_POLL_TIMEOUT.description: This parameter specifies the number of seconds between re-transmission attempts. The default value is two seconds.

SNTPC_PRIMARY_IPV4_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the IPv4 address of the primary Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server.

SNTPC_BACKUP_IPV4_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the IPv4 address of the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) backup server.

SNTPC_MULTICAST_MODE_IF.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast client mode interface.

SNTPC_MULTICAST_GROUP_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast client mode multicast group.

SNTPC_PRIMARY_IPV6_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the IPv6 address of the primary Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) server.

SNTPC_BACKUP_IPV6_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the IPv6 address of the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) backup server.

SNTPC_MULTICAST_MODE_IPV6_IF.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast client mode IPv6 interface.

SNTPC_MULTICAST_GROUP_IPV6_ADDR.summary: Multicast client mode IPv6 multicast group
SNTPC_MULTICAST_GROUP_IPV6_ADDR.description: This parameter specifies the Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) multicast client mode IPv6 multicast group.

IPNET_VLAN_S_VLAN_TPID.description: Identifies the service VLAN tag, refer to IEEE802.1ad. The default value is 0x88a8 as defined in IEEE802.1ad. The S-VLAN TPID must be a difference value than the C-VLAN TPID value 0x8100.

CACHE_DMA_POOL_INITIAL_SIZE.summary: Initial size of cache-safe memory pool, in pages

CACHE_DMA_POOL_INCREMENT_SIZE.summary: no. of pages to add to cache-safe memory pool when exhausted

FATAL_SYSTEM_CORE_DUMP_ENABLE.summary: Enable Kernel Core Dump generation for fatal system exceptions
FATAL_SYSTEM_CORE_DUMP_ENABLE.description: Generate Kernel Core Dump for fatal system exceptions

KERNEL_APPL_CORE_DUMP_ENABLE.summary: Enable Kernel Core Dump generation for kernel application
KERNEL_APPL_CORE_DUMP_ENABLE.description: Generate Kernel Core Dump for non-fatal system exceptions

CORE_DUMP_MAX_HOOKS.summary: Maximum number of Kernel Core Dump hooks
CORE_DUMP_MAX_HOOKS.description: Define the maximum number of Kernel Core Dump (Creation and Progress hooks)

CORE_DUMP_STACK_SIZE.description: Define the size of stack to use for Kernel Core Dump generation (0 means no stack switch).

CORE_DUMP_CKSUM_ENABLE.summary: Enable Kernel Core Dump checksumming facility
CORE_DUMP_CKSUM_ENABLE.description: Compute Kernel Core Dump checksum during generation

CORE_DUMP_VERBOSITY_LEVEL.description: Define verbosity level: 0 = Silent mode, 1 = Display short message on console when core dump is generated, 2 = Display detailled core dump information on console when core dump is generated.

CORE_DUMP_COPY_PROGRESS_ENABLE.summary: Install default core dump copy progress hook
CORE_DUMP_COPY_PROGRESS_ENABLE.description: Install krnl/configlette/usrCoreDump.c:coreDumpCopyProgressHook() to display progress on core dump upload on target console. To install a specific core dump copy progress hook please refer to coreDumpCopyHookAdd().

CORE_DUMP_SKIP_TEXT_SECTION.summary: Remove VxWorks text section from Kernel Core Dump
CORE_DUMP_SKIP_TEXT_SECTION.description: Remove VxWorks text section from Kernel Core Dump

CORE_DUMP_SKIP_USER_RESERVED_MEM.summary: Remove User Reserved Memory from Kernel Core Dump
CORE_DUMP_SKIP_USER_RESERVED_MEM.description: Exclude USER_RESERVED_MEM area from Kernel Core Dump

CORE_DUMP_TASKS_STACK_DUMP.summary: Dump stacks of kernel tasks to kernel core dump
CORE_DUMP_TASKS_STACK_DUMP.description: Dump stacks of kernel tasks to allow task stack tracing and local variable retrieval if code is compiled with enough debug information. Without stacks the debugger will only be able to display a one line stack trace corresponding to current program counter.

CORE_DUMP_MODULES_DATA_DUMP.summary: Dump data & Bss segments of VxWorks modules
CORE_DUMP_MODULES_DATA_DUMP.description: Dump data & Bss segments of VxWorks kernel image and downloaded kernel modules to allow debugger to access module's data.

CORE_DUMP_COMPRESSION_LEVEL.summary: ZLib Kernel Core Dump compression level

CORE_DUMP_REGION_SIZE.summary: Kernel Core Dump persistent memory region size
CORE_DUMP_REGION_SIZE.description: Size of Persistent Memory to reserve from PM_RESERVED_MEM (By default use remaining free persistent memory)

CORE_DUMP_MEM_FILTER_MAX.summary: Maximum number of kernel memory region filters
CORE_DUMP_MEM_FILTER_MAX.description: Define the number of kernel memory region filters that can installed

CORE_DUMP_RTP_ZLIB_COMPRESSION_LEVEL.summary: ZLib RTP Core Dump compression level

CORE_DUMP_RTP_FS_PATH.description: Path to store RTP Core Dump files

CORE_DUMP_MEM_POOL_PROTECTION_ENABLE.summary: Enable core dump memory pool protection
CORE_DUMP_MEM_POOL_PROTECTION_ENABLE.description: Protect core dump pool if virtual memory is enabled

CORE_DUMP_MEM_POOL_PAGE_SIZE.summary: Size of core dump memory pool pages
CORE_DUMP_MEM_POOL_PAGE_SIZE.description: Set the size of the core dump memory pool pages

MEDR_EXTENDED_ENABLE.description: Set this parameter to TRUE to enable logging trace information for each allocated block, but at the cost of increased memory used to store entries in the allocation database. The default setting is FALSE.

MEDR_FILL_FREE_ENABLE.summary: Enable filling freed blocks with pattern
MEDR_FILL_FREE_ENABLE.description: Set this parameter to TRUE to enable pattern-filling queued free blocks. This aids detecting writes into freed buffers. The default setting is FALSE.

MEDR_FREE_QUEUE_LEN.summary: Length of the free block queue
MEDR_FREE_QUEUE_LEN.description: This parameter defines the maximum length of the free queue. When a memory block is freed, instead of immediately returning it to the partition's memory pool, it is kept in a queue. This is useful for detecting references to a memory block after it has been freed. When the queue reaches the maximum length allowed, the blocks are returned to the respective memory pool in a FIFO order. Queuing is disabled when this parameter is 0. Default setting for this parameter is 64.

MEDR_BLOCK_GUARD_ENABLE.description: This parameter is used to enable guard signatures in the front and the end of each allocated block. Enabling this feature aids in detecting buffer overruns, underruns, and some heap memory corruption. The default setting is FALSE.

MEDR_POOL_SIZE.summary: Size of the memory reserved for database
MEDR_POOL_SIZE.description: This parameter is used to set the size of the memory pool used to maintain the memory block database. The default setting in the kernel is 1MB. The database uses 32 bytes per memory block without extended information enabled, and 64 bytes per block with extended information enabled (call stack trace). This pool is allocated from the kernel heap.

VM_PAGE_SIZE.description: This parameter specifies the virtual memory (VM) page size in bytes.

DATA_SEG_ALIGN.description: This parameter is passed to the linker to align the kernel data segment with the given value. Note that the default value is set to the minimum size of a MMU page when the component INCLUDE_PAGE_SIZE_OPTMIZATION is included.

KERNEL_VIRT_POOL_REGION_SIZE.summary: Size of global virtual memory region
KERNEL_VIRT_POOL_REGION_SIZE.description: This parameter sets the size of the kernel virtual memory pool region is used for dynamically managed mappings in the kernel. The default value for this 0 which indicates that the size as defined by the architecture is used (KERNEL_VIRT_POOL_RGN_SIZE). This configuration parameter allows the user the ability to lower the size based on the customer usage scenario. This allows to kernel to create pre-allocated page table entries for only the required size and thus optimize the usage of the kernel proximity heap.

SHM_DEV_NAME.description: This parameter sets the name of the POSIX shared memory object device.

DEVMEM_DEV_NAME.description: This parameter defines the name of the memory object device.

DMA32_HEAP_SIZE.description: This parameter defines the DMA32 heap reserved memory size (bytes).

MEM_PART_CACHE_GLOBAL_ENABLE.description: This parameter enable's task level memory caching                         globally for all tasks. When it is set to TRUE, then the task                         level memory caching is enabled globally for all tasks.                         That is when any task is created the task level memory                         caching is enabled automatically. When the task is                         deleted any memory that is cached in the memory cache                         is released and the task level memory caching is                         disabled automatically. When it is set to FALSE, then                         the task level memory caching is not enabled until the                         memPartCacheCreate( ) function is called in the context                         of the task. When the task is deleted any memory that                         is cached in the memory cache is released and the task                         level memory caching is disabled automatically.

USER_RESERVED_MEM.description: This parameter sets the reserved memory size (bytes).

CLEAR_USER_RESERVED_MEMORY_ON_COLD_BOOT.description: This parameter will have user-reserved memory cleared on cold reboot when it is set to TRUE.

RTP_SHELL_CMD_VERBOSITY.description: This parameter controls the default verbosity of executing a process from shell (rtp exec).

RTP_SHELL_CMD_PRIORITY.summary: Default priority for RTP initial task
RTP_SHELL_CMD_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the default priority for the initial task of an RTP spawned from the shell by 'rtp exec' or 'rtpSp()'.

RTP_SHELL_CMD_OPTIONS.description: This parameter sets the default options for RTPs spawned from the shell by 'rtp exec' or 'rtpSp()'. See rtpSpawn() for details.

RTP_SHELL_CMD_STACK_SIZE.summary: Default stack size for RTP initial task
RTP_SHELL_CMD_STACK_SIZE.description: This parameter sets the default stack size for the initial task of an RTP spawned from the shell by 'rtp exec' or 'rtpSp()'. The default size is 65,536 bytes.

RTP_SHELL_CMD_DELAY.description: After calling rtpSpawn(), the rtpSp() function will delay for this many system clock ticks before returning. The default is zero.

RTP_SHELL_CMD_TASK_OPTIONS.summary: Default task options for RTP initial task
RTP_SHELL_CMD_TASK_OPTIONS.description: This parameter sets the default task options for the initial task of an RTP spawned by 'rtp exec' or 'rtpSp()'. See taskSpawn() for details.

RTP_APPL_CMD_SCRIPT_FILE.description: This parameter provides the full pathname of the file that contains the startup script for launching the real-time process (RTP).

VXBFLASH_CFG_STR.summary: Config string for VxBus driver based TFFS partitions
VXBFLASH_CFG_STR.description: Specifies the configuration for tffs partitions, and is composed of Flash chip strings - "<Flash chip 0 string>;<Flash chip 1 string>...". And Flash chip string is composed of following information "$<Flash instance name>#<index>:                         <start address>,<length>,<boot size>,<partition name>".

TFFS_DRIVE_NUMBER.description: Specifies the drive number of the TFFS flash drive. Valid values are 0 through N-1, where N is the number of socket interfaces provided by the BSP.

TFFS_REMOVABLE.description: When set to FALSE, flash devices are not removable.

TFFS_MOUNT_POINT.description: Specifies the mount point, for example, /tffs0/.

BRIDGE_PORTS.description: Specify list of interfaces to be added as bridge ports.e.g.,"fei,0,fei,1,elPci,0"

BRIDGE_IP_ADDR.description: Specify the bridge IP address. e.g.,"10.11.12.1"

BRIDGE_IP_MASK.description: Specify the network mask of the bridge. e.g.,0xFF000000

BRIDGE_IPV6_ADDR.description: Specify the IPv6 address of the bridge. e.g.,"2001:DB8:1234:100::1"

BRIDGE_IPV6_PREFIXLEN.description: Specify the IPv6 prefix length of the bridge. e.g.,64

BRIDGE_AGING_TIMEOUT.description: Specify the bridge aging time. e.g.,300

NUM_RAWFS_BLOCKS.summary: max block (sector) number buffer for read or write

VDFS_PRIO_SCHED_ENABLE.summary: Enables exclusive access to media by high priority blocks
VDFS_PRIO_SCHED_ENABLE.description: This parameter enables a simple scheduler in VDFS that ensures exclusive access for a defined amount of time for high priority blocks.

VDFS_PRIO_SCHED_TIMEOUT.summary: Timeout in microseconds for high priority blocks
VDFS_PRIO_SCHED_TIMEOUT.description: This value reflacts the amount of time high priority blocks from different guests are permitted exclusive access to shared media.

TSN_CLK_INT_THROTTLE_INTERVAL.description: This parameter sets the minimum time between interrupts that the device will generate for incoming packets and time sync events. The value is expressed in microseconds "<us>". The valid range is device specific. To use the device driver's default setting, set the value to "<-1>".

VXB_MAX_INTR_VEC.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of interrupt vector table slots.

VXB_MAX_INTR_CHAIN.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of interrupt chaining entries.

VXB_MAX_INTR_DEFER.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of interrupt operation deferral entries.

SYS_MEM_DESC_NUM.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of system memory descriptors available to describe continuous blocks of physical memory.

SYS_VX_START_PHYS_ADRS.description: This parameter specifies address of RAM where VxWorks starts to use statically. It should be mapped to the virtual address of LOCAL_MEM_LOCAL_ADRS.

CONSOLE_NAME.description: Name of TTY device to use for console

IDLE_TASK_EXCEPTION_STACK_SIZE.summary: Size of the idle tasks' exception stack
IDLE_TASK_EXCEPTION_STACK_SIZE.description: The size of the stack used for reschedule and task switch hooks.

SYSCLK_TIMER_NAME.description: This parameter sets the system clock device. If the value is NULL, the device is auto-selected.

AUXCLK_TIMER_NAME.summary: Auxiliary Clock Device Name (NULL is auto-assign)
AUXCLK_TIMER_NAME.description: This parameter specifies the defines the auxiliary clock device name. If left NULL, it will be automatically assigned.

TIMESTAMP_TIMER_NAME.description: This parameter sets the timestamp device. If the value is NULL,

SYS_CLK_RATE.description: This parameter specifies the sets the number of ticks per second. Its default value is 60. Current processors can accommodate much higher system clock rates, which also will increase the accuracy of POSIX timers and watchdogs.

SYS_CLK_RATE_MIN.description: This parameter specifies the sets the minimum system clock rate. Its default value is 60. Attempting to set a value below the minimum returns an error.

SYS_CLK_RATE_MAX.description: This parameter specifies the sets the maximum system clock rate. Its default value is 300. Attempting to set a value above maximum will fail and return an error. Modern processors can accommodate a much higher system clock rate.

AUX_CLK_RATE_MIN.description: This parameter specifies the sets the minimum auxiliary clock rate. Its default value is 60.

AUX_CLK_RATE_MAX.description: This parameter specifies the sets the maximum auxiliary clock rate. Its default value is 1000.

AUX_CLK_RATE.description: This parameter specifies the sets the number of ticks per second. Its default value is 100.

VXBUS_DRIVER_DEFER_LIST_STR.summary: Config string for VxBus deferred drivers
VXBUS_DRIVER_DEFER_LIST_STR.description: Specifies the drivers which are deferred to initialize composed of driver name strings - "<Driver 0 name string>:<Driver 1 name string>...".

ISR_DEFER_MODE.description: This parameter specifies the interrupt service routines deferral handling global mode.

ISR_DEFER_TASK_STACK_SIZE.description: This parameter specifies the interrupt service routines deferral task stack size.

ISR_DEFER_TASK_PRIO.description: This parameter specifies the interrupt service routine deferral task priority. Changing this parameter without understanding the exact implications of your change can result in system instability. The default is zero.

STATIC_MMU_TABLE_BASE.description: This parameter defines the static MMU table base address for the early MMU.

DTS_FILE.summary: dts file name to be used

ARM_CPU0_INDEX.description: CPU ID of core0 cannot be read from the DTS because it is referenced early in the boot process, before the DTS is ready. This parameter specifies an ID for core0 that can be used in a CPU identification function, which fixes the issue of core0's ID being                unreadable.

BOOT_TEST_DISABLE_AUTOBOOT.description: This parameter disables autoboot when set to true.

BOOTAPP_GENERIC_NVRAM_OFFSET.summary: Offset in file to the start of NVRAM space
BOOTAPP_GENERIC_NVRAM_OFFSET.description: Offset in file to the start of NVRAM space (bytes)

BOOT_DISABLE_MMU_BEFORE_ENTRY.description: Disables the MMU prior to jumping to the entry point of a boot application image. The default is TRUE.

BOOT_START_DELAY.description: Delay time after the executable image is loaded, and before jumping to the entry point. This can be useful to ensure that the loader completes deferred work (for example in the network in stack). Time is expressed in milliseconds. The default is one second.

BOOT_FS_DEV_MOUNT_CHECK.description: Enable checking mount status for boot FS device before loading image file from it.

BOOT_FS_CHECK_ATTEMPTS.description: Number of times an attempt will be made to check FS boot device mounting.

BOOT_FS_ATTEMPT_DELAY.description: Amount of time in system ticks to delay between attempts to check mounting FS boot device.

BOOT_USB_OPEN_ATTEMPTS.description: Number of times an attempt will be made to open the USB boot device.

BOOT_USB_ATTEMPT_DELAY.summary: Delay between USB device open attempts.
BOOT_USB_ATTEMPT_DELAY.description: Amount of time in system ticks to delay between attempts to open the USB boot device.

USB2_MSC_DRIVE_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver drive base name
USB2_MSC_DRIVE_NAME.description: Drive base name associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

DOSFS_DEFAULT_MAX_FILES.description: Defines the maximum number of files. The default is 20.

DOSFS_DEFAULT_CREATE_OPTIONS.description: The default parameter for the dosFsLib component. It specifies the action to be taken when a dosFs file system is instantiated. Its default is DOSFS_CHK_NONE, so the media is not checked for errors on mount.

DOSFS_COMPAT_NT.description: Directory entry NT flag compatibility with Windows, only used for FAT32.

DOSFS_DEFAULT_DATA_DIR_CACHE_SIZE.summary: Disk data and directory-group cache size
DOSFS_DEFAULT_DATA_DIR_CACHE_SIZE.description: Defines the disk-data and directory-group cache size for each dosFs volume.

DOSFS_DEFAULT_FAT_CACHE_SIZE.description: Defines the size of the FAT group cache for each dosFs volume.

DOSFS_BLOCKS_PER_DATA_DIR_CACHE_GROUP.description: Sets the default block group size in the Data/Dir cache. The maximum value is 8192.

DOSFS_BLOCKS_PER_FAT_CACHE_GROUP.description: Sets the default block group size in the Fat cache. The maximum value is 8192.

DOSFS_CACHE_BACKGROUND_FLUSH_TASK_ENABLE.summary: Enable background flush task for dosFs cache
DOSFS_CACHE_BACKGROUND_FLUSH_TASK_ENABLE.description: The cache-flushing mode. Set to FALSE (default), cache-flushing takes place in the context of the user's read/write task. Set to                     TRUE, a separate high-priority task is spawned to carry out cache                     flushing. Use of a separate task speeds up write operations                     (especially when dosFs is configured with a larger cache size), but                     using a separate high-priority task might not be suitable for                     systems with strict real-time requirements.

DOSFS_PRTMSG_LEVEL.description: Print messages according to this value.

DOSFS_DEFAULT_VOL_BIO_BUFFER_SIZE.summary: Default size in blocks of a bio data buffer

HRFS_DEFAULT_MAX_FILES.description: Maximum number of files that can be open on an HRFS volume

HRFS_DEFAULT_ERROR_HANDLE_POLICY.description: HRFS default error handle policy, the value could be: HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_STOP_IO - (0), HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_STOP_IO_SILENT - (1), HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_TO_EDR - (2), HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_TO_USER_FUNC - (3), HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_IGNORE - (4)

HRFS_DEFAULT_ERROR_HANDLE_USER_FUNC.summary: HRFS User Defined Error Handle Routine
HRFS_DEFAULT_ERROR_HANDLE_USER_FUNC.description: HRFS user defined error handle routine, only valid when HRFS_DEFAULT_ERROR_HANDLE_POLICY is HRFS_ERR_HANDLE_TO_USER_FUNC

HRFS_LOSTFOUND_AUTOCLEAN.summary: HRFS File System Auto Delete File in Lost Found Directory
HRFS_LOSTFOUND_AUTOCLEAN.description: Auto delete all files in ".lost+found" directory when HRFS mounted.

INCLUDE_HRFS_DIRECT_COMMIT.description: HRFS disable transaction task and make every transaction commit directly to XBD.

HRFS_UID_GID_ENABLE.summary: HRFS support for user and group IDs
HRFS_UID_GID_ENABLE.description: HRFS support for user and group ownership of files and directories

HRFS_FORMAT_BUFFER_SIZE.description: HRFS format tool write buffer size in bytes. The value will be ignored if it is smaller than HRFS block size.

ROMFS_MAX_OPEN_FILES.description: This parameter specifies the maximum number of files that can be opened. By default, it is set to 16.

ROMFS_DEV_NAME.description: This parameter specifies the device name. By default, it is /romfs.

SMC_ACTLR_IMM.summary: SMC call immediate value for ACTLR
SMC_ACTLR_IMM.description: SMC call immediate value in the SMC call for updating ACTLR, if the default value is not align with the board document, it should be overriden in BSP

SMC_ACTLR_VAL.description: SMC call number for updating ACTLR, if the default value is not align with the board document, it should be overriden in BSP

SMC_L2ACTLR_IMM.summary: SMC call immediate value for L2ACTLR
SMC_L2ACTLR_IMM.description: SMC call immediate value in the SMC call for updating L2ACTLR, if the default value is not align with the board document, it should be overriden in BSP

SMC_L2ACTLR_VAL.description: SMC call number for updating L2ACTLR, if the default value is not align with the board document, it should be overriden in BSP

SMC_PL310_CTRL_IMM.summary: SMC call immediate value for PL310 control register
SMC_PL310_CTRL_IMM.description: SMC call immediate value in the SMC call for updating PL310 control register.

SMC_PL310_CTRL_VAL.summary: SMC call number for PL310 control register
SMC_PL310_CTRL_VAL.description: SMC call number for updating PL310 control register.
