SMC_PL310_AUXCTRL_IMM.summary: SMC call immediate value for PL310 auxiliary control register
SMC_PL310_AUXCTRL_IMM.description: SMC call immediate value in the SMC call for updating PL310 auxiliary control register.

SMC_PL310_AUXCTRL_VAL.summary: SMC call number for PL310 auxiliary control register
SMC_PL310_AUXCTRL_VAL.description: SMC call number for updating PL310 auxiliary control register.

SMC_PL310_LATCTRL_IMM.summary: SMC call immediate value for PL310 latency control register
SMC_PL310_LATCTRL_IMM.description: SMC call immediate value in the SMC call for updating PL310 latency control register.

SMC_PL310_LATCTRL_VAL.summary: SMC call number for PL310 latency control register
SMC_PL310_LATCTRL_VAL.description: SMC call number for updating PL310 latency control register.

TMP_DIR_SIZE.description: Number of blocks in the /tmp RAM disk. Each block is 512 bytes.

FS_NAMES_SATA_DISK0.description: "disk:" and "partition:" are the keywords. Disk names and partition names begin with '/'. Disk names and partition names are separated by ';'. Partition names are separated by ','. NOTE: The length of the disk name should be less than 7. The length of the partition name should be less than 10. For example : "disk:/disk0;partition:/p01,/p02,,p04" "/disk0;partition:/p01,/p02,,p04" The partition names are "/p01","/p02","/disk0:3","/p04". "partition:/p01,/p02,,p04". The partition names are "/p01","/p02","/ata0:3","/p04".

FS_NAMES_SATA_DISK1.description: "disk:" and "partition:" are the keywords. Disk names and partition names begin with '/'. Disk names and partition names are separated by ';'. Partition names are separated by ','. NOTE: The length of the disk name should be less than 7. The length of the partition name should be less than 10. For example : "disk:/disk1;partition:/p11,/p12,,p14"; "/disk1;partition:/p11,/p12,,p14" The partition names are "/p11","/p12","/disk1:3","/p14". "partition:/p11,/p12,,p14". The partition names are "/p11","/p12","/ata1:3","/p14".

FS_NAMES_SATA_DISK2.description: "disk:" and "partition:" are the keywords. Disk names and partition names begin with '/'. Disk names and partition names are separated by ';'. Partition names are separated by ','. NOTE: The length of the disk name should be less than 7. The length of the partition name should be less than 10.

FS_NAMES_SATA_DISK3.description: "disk:" and "partition:" are the keywords. Disk names and partition names begin with '/'. Disk names and partition names are separated by ';'. Partition names are separated by ','. NOTE: The length of the disk name should be less than 7. The length of the partition name should be less than 10.

SATA_DISK_NAME_LEN.description: The maximum length for SATA disk 0 - 3 logical names. Over long characters are truncated.

TRACE_LEVEL.summary: Set the trace level of the driver
TRACE_LEVEL.description: Options are: TRACE_LEVEL_ERROR, TRACE_LEVEL_WARNING, TRACE_LEVEL_INFO, TRACE_LEVEL_DEBUG

POLL_INTERVAL.summary: Poll interval in milliseconds for non-interrupt cards

BASE_DIR.summary: Set the base directory of the driver

DRV_TOUCH_SCREEN_VIRTUAL_MT_DIS_WIDTH.description: Defines the width of the display resolution in pixels. The default is 800.

DRV_TOUCH_SCREEN_VIRTUAL_MT_DIS_HEIGHT.description: Defines the height of the display resolution in pixels. The default is 480.

EVDEV_MSG_NUM.description: This parameter is used to define the number of the messages for buffering the input events.

EVDEV_KBD_TYPE_MATIC_PERIOD.description: This parameter defines the period for checking a key long press in milliseconds.

DTB_RELOC_ADDR.description: The device tree blob (DTB) needs to be relocated to a safe address to avoid being overwritten. It should be below the address at which VxWorks is loaded (RAM_LOW_ADRS) and the reserved start region.

DTB_MAX_LEN.description: This parameter specifies the maximum size, in bytes, that the device tree blob (DTB) can be allocated due to its position in RAM.

FTL_SERVICE_TASK_ENABLE.description: Creates a background task for performing time-consuming operations including garbage collection, wear-leveling, discarding (optional) and flushing cache (optional).

FTL_MEM_BUDGET_CFG_PROFILE.summary: Configure the memory budget for ftl
FTL_MEM_BUDGET_CFG_PROFILE.description: (0 - minimum memory, 1 - moderate memory (default), 2 - maximum memory). The minimum memory profile will make ftl use the minimum memory that it requires to work, which trades time for space. The maximum memory means that ftl can allocate memory for use when it deems it's necessary for performance's sake. The moderate memory indicates a balance between the other two profiles.

FTL_AUTO_MOUNT.description: Mounts all the ftl managed devices detected at system boot phase when set to true.

FTL_DATA_CACHE_SIZE.description: Sets the data cache size (in bytes) for each mounted ftl device

LOOP_FS_MAX_IMAGES.description: This parameter sets the maximum number of images that can be used for loop file system. By default, it is set to 32.

LOOP_FS_DEFAULT_SVR_TASK_PRIORITY.description: This parameter sets the default service task priority. The default value is 100.

LOOP_FS_DEFAULT_FS_WAIT_SECONDS.summary: Default wait timeout for file system mounting, in seconds.
LOOP_FS_DEFAULT_FS_WAIT_SECONDS.description: This parameter sets the default wait timeout for file system mounting, in seconds. The default value is 10. 0 is not valid parameter and will be ignored.

MTD_CFG_STR.description: Specifies the configuration for MTD component, and is composed of Flash chip strings - "<Flash chip 0 string>;<Flash chip 1 string>...". And Flash chip string is composed of Flash partitions strings - "$<Flash instance name>#<chip index>:                        <Flash partition 0 string>;                        <Flash partition 1 string>...". And then Flash partition string is the following - "<start block address>,<block count>,<MTD device name>#                        <Flash group index>,<Flash usage>".

USB_MEM_PART_SIZE.summary: USB Initial Memory Partition Size (in bytes)
USB_MEM_PART_SIZE.description: USB Initial Memory Partition Size (in bytes)

USB_CHECK_RESUBMIT_URB_FLAG.summary: Check URB resubmited multiple times enable flag (TRUE or FALSE)
USB_CHECK_RESUBMIT_URB_FLAG.description: Check if a URB is resubmitted multiple times with the same transfer buffer (TRUE or FALSE)

USB_WAIT_TIME_OUT_VALUE.summary: USB Waiting Time Out Value (in ms)
USB_WAIT_TIME_OUT_VALUE.description: USB Waiting Time Out Value (in ms)

USB_HUB_CHECK_POWER_ENABLE.description: In some cases, power check function needs to be turned off.

USB_PRESTAGE_HOOK.description: This user-defined USB prestage hook is called once after USB stack initialization. This hook must not be set to NULL.

USB_TRACK_TU.description: USB TU Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_TRACK_USBD.description: USB Driver Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_GEN2_HELPER_LATENCY.description: USB GEN2 Helper Task Latency between 2 attempts to delete devices (Milliseconds)

USB_GEN2_HELPER_DELETABLE_QUEUE_SIZE.description: USB GEN2 Helper queue size (max elems in the queue)

USB_TRACK_HUB.description: USB HUB Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_TRACK_GEN2_HLP.summary: USB GEN2 Helper Debug Level BitMap
USB_TRACK_GEN2_HLP.description: USB GEN2 Helper Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_GEN2_KEYBOARD_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 keyboard driver base name
USB_GEN2_KEYBOARD_NAME.description: Device base name associated to the GEN2 keyboard device

USB_GEN2_KEYBOARD_TYPEMATIC_MS.summary: USB GEN2 keyboard Typematic Rate in ms
USB_GEN2_KEYBOARD_TYPEMATIC_MS.description: USB GEN2 keyboard Typematic Rate in ms Defines how often the current pressed key will be sent to the application (ASCII MODE). -1 is FOREVER, any other integer is the time in ms

USB_TRACK_GEN2_KBD.summary: USB GEN2 Keyboard Debug Level BitMap
USB_TRACK_GEN2_KBD.description: USB GEN2 Keyboard Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB2_MSC_FS_INTERFACE_MODE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver filesystem interface mode
USB2_MSC_FS_INTERFACE_MODE.description: Filesystem interface mode (USB2_MSC_FS_INTERFACE_XBD) to use for the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_DIRECT_ACCESS_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver direct access enable flag
USB2_MSC_DIRECT_ACCESS_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable direct access module of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_DYNAMIC_CONFIG.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver dynamic configuration
USB2_MSC_DYNAMIC_CONFIG.description: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver dynamic configuration support

USB2_MSC_COMPLIANCE_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver compliance test module enable flag
USB2_MSC_COMPLIANCE_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable compliance test module of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_CBI_TRANSPORT_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver CB[I] transport module enable flag
USB2_MSC_CBI_TRANSPORT_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable CB[I] transport module of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_QUIRKY_DEV_SUPPORT_LEVEL.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage quirky device global support level
USB2_MSC_QUIRKY_DEV_SUPPORT_LEVEL.description: USB GEN2 Mass Storage quirky device global support level(0:No support, 1:Relaxed support, 2:Support all)

USB2_MSC_MAX_NAME_SZ.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver drive base name max length
USB2_MSC_MAX_NAME_SZ.description: Max length of drive base name associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver XBD service task base name
USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_NAME.description: XBD service task base name associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_MAX_DEVICES.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver max devices
USB2_MSC_MAX_DEVICES.description: Max number of devices supported by the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_MAX_DRIVES.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver max LUNs per device
USB2_MSC_MAX_DRIVES.description: Max count of LUNs to be supported by the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_DIRECT_ACCESS_BASE_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver direct access base name
USB2_MSC_DIRECT_ACCESS_BASE_NAME.description: Direct access base name associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_COMPLIANCE_LOG_FILE_BASE_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver compliance test output file name
USB2_MSC_COMPLIANCE_LOG_FILE_BASE_NAME.description: Compliance test log file name associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_MEDIUM_HOTPLUG_CHECK_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver medium hotplug check enable flag
USB2_MSC_MEDIUM_HOTPLUG_CHECK_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable medium hotplug check of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_WRITE_PROTECTION_CHECK_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver write protection check enable flag
USB2_MSC_WRITE_PROTECTION_CHECK_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable write protection check of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_MEDIUM_HOTPLUG_CHECK_INTERVAL.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver medium hotplug check interval (in ms)
USB2_MSC_MEDIUM_HOTPLUG_CHECK_INTERVAL.description: Medium hotplug check interval(in ms) for the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_STATUS_CHECK_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver status check enable flag
USB2_MSC_STATUS_CHECK_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable status check of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_ODD_SECTOR_CHECK_ENABLE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver odd sector number check enable flag
USB2_MSC_ODD_SECTOR_CHECK_ENABLE.description: Flag to enable or disable odd sector number check of the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_RESET_TIMEOUT.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver reset timeout (in ms)
USB2_MSC_RESET_TIMEOUT.description: Reset timeout (in ms) for the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_COMMAND_TIMEOUT.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver command timeout (in ms)
USB2_MSC_COMMAND_TIMEOUT.description: Command timeout (in ms) for the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_STATUS_TIMEOUT.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver status timeout (in ms)
USB2_MSC_STATUS_TIMEOUT.description: Status timeout (in ms) for the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_MAX_TRANSFER_BLOCKS.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver maximum blocks per transfer
USB2_MSC_MAX_TRANSFER_BLOCKS.description: Maximum blocks per transfer for the GEN2 Mass Storage driver

USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_PRIORITY.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver XBD service task priority
USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_PRIORITY.description: XBD service task priority associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_OPTIONS.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver XBD service task options
USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_OPTIONS.description: XBD service task options associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_STACK_SIZE.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage driver XBD service task stack size
USB2_MSC_SERVICE_TASK_STACK_SIZE.description: XBD service task stack size associated to the GEN2 Mass Storage device

USB_TRACK_GEN2_MSC.summary: USB GEN2 Mass Storage Debug Level BitMap
USB_TRACK_GEN2_MSC.description: USB GEN2 Mass Storage Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_GEN2_MOUSE_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Mouse driver base name
USB_GEN2_MOUSE_NAME.description: Device base name associated to the GEN2 mouse device

USB_TRACK_GEN2_MSE.summary: USB GEN2 Mouse Debug Level BitMap
USB_TRACK_GEN2_MSE.description: USB GEN2 Mouse Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_GEN2_END_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 End driver base name
USB_GEN2_END_NAME.description: Drive Base Name associated to the GEN2 End device

USB_GEN2_END_IP_ADDRESS.summary: USB GEN2 END Device IP Address
USB_GEN2_END_IP_ADDRESS.description: USB GEN2 END Device IP Address

USB_GEN2_END_NET_MASK.summary: USB GEN2 END Device Net Mask
USB_GEN2_END_NET_MASK.description: USB GEN2 END Device Net Mask

USB_GEN2_END_COMMON_TASK_PRIORITY.summary: USB GEN2 End Common Task priority
USB_GEN2_END_COMMON_TASK_PRIORITY.description: USB GEN2 End Common Task priority

USB_GEN2_END_ZERO_LENGTH_PACKET.summary: USB GEN2 End Zero Length Packet Support
USB_GEN2_END_ZERO_LENGTH_PACKET.description: USB GEN2 End Zero Length Packet Support

USB_TRACK_GEN2_END.summary: USB GEN2 END Debug Level BitMap
USB_TRACK_GEN2_END.description: USB GEN2 END Debug Level BitMap Enable By Set (Bit 0:INFO, Bit 1:ERROR, Bit 2:WARNING, Bit 3:NORMAL, Bit 4:VERBOSE)

USB_GEN2_PRINTER_NAME.summary: USB GEN2 Printer driver base name

XLNX_ZYNQ_END_BD_RX_NUM.description: This parameter specifies the number of receive buffer descriptor that is used in the driver.

XLNX_ZYNQ_END_BD_TX_NUM.description: This parameter specifies the number of transmit buffer descriptor that is used in the driver.

PHY_STATUS_POST_CHECK_ENABLE.description: If PHY status post check is enabled, the END driver will not only check the PHY status register but also some of the error counters. The END driver will not report LINK_UP status to the network stack until these counters are cleared to 0. Waiting for the error counters will take much more time than just checking the PHY status register. So by default, PHY status post check is disabled. This parameter should be set to TRUE only for some special cases, such as 82574L connected with a Netgear ProSafe 16-port GS116 switch or a Cisco 10-port SG300-10 switch via a 2-pair cable.

DRV_TPM_INSTANCE_DEV_NAME.description: I/O system name for the TPM device

DRV_IA_TPM_INSTANCE_0_BASE_ADDR.description: Memory mapping register base address for first TPM device at locality 0.

DRV_IA_TPM_INSTANCE_0_REG_INTERVAL.description: Memory mapping register address interval for first TPM device at locality 0.

MMC_DEVNAME.description: This parameter set the MMC device name

NVME_MAX_XFER_SIZE.description: The maximum transfer size of NVMe controller driver. The default is 0x40000 bytes. The setting should be between 0x1000 and 0x200000, and must be integer multiple of 0x1000. The actual maximum transfer size is smaller value between the setting and Maximum Data Transfer Size (MDTS) the contoller supports.

NVME_ADMIN_ENTRIES.description: The entries of administrator queue. The default is 128. The setting should be between 2 and 4096. If it is too small it may cause NVMe not to work.

NVME_ADMIN_TRACKERS.description: The trackers of administrator queue. The default is 16. The setting should be between 2 and 128. If it is too small it may cause NVMe not to work.

NVME_IO_ENTRIES.description: The entries of i/o queue. The default is 256. The setting should be between 2 and 65536. If it is too small it may cause NVMe not to work.

NVME_IO_TRACKERS.description: The trackers of i/o queue. The default is 128. The setting should be between 4 and 1024. If it is too small it may cause NVMe not to work.

NVME_INT_COAL_TIME.description: It specifies the recommended maximum time (in microseconds) that a controller may delay an interrupt due to interrupt coalescing. The default is 0 (no delay). The setting should be between 0 and 25500.

NVME_INT_COAL_THRESHOLD.description: It specifies the recommended minimum number of completion queue entries to aggregate per interrupt vector before signaling an interrupt to the host. This is a 0's based                     value. The default is 0. The setting should be between 0                     and 255.

NVME_MULTIPLE_IOQ_ENABLE.description: It defines if creates multiple i/o queues or not. The default is TRUE, multiple i/o queues are created. Parameter "NVME_CPUS_PER_IOQ" defines CPU number for an i/o queue. If FALSE, single i/o queue is created for all CPUs.

NVME_CPUS_PER_IOQ.description: It specifies the CPU number for a i/o queue. The default is 1. The setting should be between 1 and CPU number on platform.

NVME_FORCE_INTX_ENABLE.summary: Enable forced use of legacy PCI interrupt
NVME_FORCE_INTX_ENABLE.description: It defines if use legacy PCI interrupt or not. The default is FALSE, use MSI instead. If TRUE, use legacy PCI interrupt.

NVME_TIMEOUT_PERIOD.description: It specifies timeout period. The default is 30 seconds. The setting should be between 5 and 120.

NVME_RETRY_COUNT.description: It specifies retry count. The default is 4. Value 0 means no retry.

NVME_ABORT_CMD_ENABLE.description: The abort command is used to abort a specific command previously submitted to the administrator submission queue or an i/o submission queue.

SD_DEVNAME.description: This parameter set the SD device name

DRV_TPM_INTERRUPT_ENABLE.description: When set to FALSE, disable the Interrupt mode. The TPM driver will work at polling mode. When set to TRUE, the TPM driver will try to enable the interrupt mode. If failed, the driver will work at polling mode.

VIRT_WDT_NO_WAY_OUT.summary: Virtual Timer Watchdog no way out
VIRT_WDT_NO_WAY_OUT.description: This parameter specifies that the watchdog cannot be stopped once the device was opened.

VIRT_WDT_NO_REBOOT.description: This parameter specifies that the watchdog should not reboot the system on time-out, but only print a message.

USB_CDNS3_IMX_ENABLE.summary: IMX specific wrapper for the Cadence USBSS-DRD controller driver
USB_CDNS3_IMX_ENABLE.description: Enable IMX specific wrapper for the Cadence USBSS-DRD controller driver

RZN1_USB_TCD_PRODUCT_ID.description: This defines the Product ID used as Device Desriptor - Can be overwritten by DTS property

RZN1_USB_TCD_BCD_DEVICE.summary: USB Target Device BCD Device Number
RZN1_USB_TCD_BCD_DEVICE.description: This defines the BCD Device Number used as Device Desriptor The only valid version numbers are 0x0100 (USB1.0), 0x0110 (USB1.1) and 0x0200 (USB2.0) - Can be overwritten by DTS property

RZN1_USB_TCD_SPEED_CAP.description: USB Target Speed Capability Bitwise of (1<<USB_SPEED_xxx) _LOW, _FULL or _HIGH - Can be overwritten by DTS property

RZN1_USB_TCD_TASK_PRIORITY.description: USB Target Task Priority - Can be overwritten by DTS property

RZN1_USB_TCD_SRAM_SIZE.description: USB Target Sram Size - Can be overwritten by DTS property

RZN1_USB_TCD_NBSRAMPKT.summary: USB Target Number of Sram Packets per endpoint
RZN1_USB_TCD_NBSRAMPKT.description: USB Target Number of Sram Packets per endpoint - Can be overwritten by DTS property

SYS_DMA32_MEM_ATTR.description: This parameter specifies the virtual memory (VM) attribute for DMA32 memory descriptors used to provide a DMA memory block below the 4 GB physical address if INCLUDE_DMA32_MEM is defined.

SYS_DMA32_MEM_ATTR_MASK.summary: System DMA32 memory descriptor attribute mask
SYS_DMA32_MEM_ATTR_MASK.description: This parameter specifies the virtual memory attribute mask for DMA32 memory descriptors that are used to provide a DMA memory block below the 4 GB physical address if INCLUDE_DMA32_MEM is defined.
